original: shes rab mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: shes rab mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: and is endowed with nonconceptual intuition.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
translated: It fulfills all wishes.

original: sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum //
analyzed: sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum //
translated: It has three fruitions for sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ji lta bar tshul khrims la sogs pa 'di dag gis yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ji lta bar tshul khrims la sogs pa 'di dag gis yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the characteristics of generosity are fourfold, so should one understand the characteristics of morality, etc.

original: 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: Their resistances are immorality, malice, laziness, distraction, and false wisdom, respectively.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid ni tshul khrims la sogs pas gzhan dag la lus dang / ngag thams cad yang dag par sdom pa dang / gnod par byed pa la bzod pa dang / grogs dang / yid la 'thad pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid ni tshul khrims la sogs pas gzhan dag la lus dang / ngag thams cad yang dag par sdom pa dang / gnod par byed pa la bzod pa dang / grogs dang / yid la 'thad pa dang /
translated: Fulfilling all wishes is the restraint of all body and speech in regard to others through morality, etc., the tolerance of harm, the assistance to others through effort, the non-abandonment of others through meditation, and the teaching of the Dharma through wisdom.

original: the tshom gcod pas 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gcod pas 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it fulfills their desires by resolving their doubts.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa nyid ni /
translated: Maturation of beings is

original: tshul khrims la sogs pas mgu bar byas te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pas mgu bar byas te /
translated: through pleasing them with generosity and the others,

original: theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽go rims rnam par @198a * //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro // go rims rnam par @198a * //
translated: and through bringing them to maturity in the three vehicles.

original: dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //🔽snga ma la brten phyi ma ste //
analyzed: dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa // snga ma la brten phyi ma ste //
translated: The order of the perfections is taught🔽in terms of mutual dependence,

original: dman dang mchog tu gnas phyir dang // rags pa dang ni phra ba'i phyir //🔽de dag rim par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: dman dang mchog tu gnas phyir dang // rags pa dang ni phra ba'i phyir // de dag rim par bstan pa yin //
translated: inferior and superior, and gross and subtle.

original: rgyu gsum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag rim par bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag rim par bstan te /
translated: The order of the perfections is taught in terms of three reasons:🔽in terms of mutual dependence, because the later ones arise in dependence on the former;

original: snga ma la brten nas phyi ma skye ba'i phyir ni longs spyod la mi lta ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par len to //
analyzed: snga ma la brten nas phyi ma skye ba'i phyir ni longs spyod la mi lta ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par len to //
translated: in terms of inferiority and superiority, because the later ones are superior to the former;🔽and in terms of grossness and subtlety, because the later ones are more subtle than the former.🔽The perfection of generosity is taught first because the later perfections are superior to the former.🔽The perfection of morality is taught next, because one who is not attached to possessions takes up morality.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of patience is taught next, because one who is moral becomes patient.

original: bzod pa dang ldan na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: The perfection of effort is taught next, because one who is patient undertakes with effort.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed do //
translated: When one has undertaken perseverance, one generates meditative concentration.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so ;🔽/ snga ma dman la phyi ma mchog tu gnas pa'i phyir ni sbyin pa ni dman la /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so ; / snga ma dman la phyi ma mchog tu gnas pa'i phyir ni sbyin pa ni dman la /
translated: When one has settled the mind in meditative equipoise, one gains thorough knowledge of reality as it is.

original: tshul khrims ni mchog yin pa nas /🔽de bzhin du bsam gtan ni dman la /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni mchog yin pa nas / de bzhin du bsam gtan ni dman la /
translated: Giving is inferior and morality superior, and so on up to:

original: shes rab ni mchog yin pa'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: shes rab ni mchog yin pa'i bar du yin no //
translated: concentration is inferior and wisdom superior.

original: snga ma ni rags la phyi ma ni phra ba'i phyir ni sbyin pa ni 'jug sla ba'i phyir dang / bya sla ba'i phyir rags la /
analyzed: snga ma ni rags la phyi ma ni phra ba'i phyir ni sbyin pa ni 'jug sla ba'i phyir dang / bya sla ba'i phyir rags la /
translated: Giving is coarse because it is easy to do and easy to enter into,

original: tshul khrims ni de bas ches 'jug dka' ba'i phyir dang / ches bya dka' ba'i phyir phra ba nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni de bas ches 'jug dka' ba'i phyir dang / ches bya dka' ba'i phyir phra ba nas /
translated: and morality is subtle because it is harder to do and harder to enter into.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan ni rags la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan ni rags la /
translated: Concentration is coarse and wisdom subtle, and so on up to:

original: shes rab ni phra ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: shes rab ni phra ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: giving is coarse and wisdom subtle.

original: nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of synonyms

original: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pha dang // bsil ba 'thob dang khro bzod dang // mchog sbyor ba dang yid 'dzin dang // don dam shes pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pha dang // bsil ba 'thob dang khro bzod dang // mchog sbyor ba dang yid 'dzin dang // don dam shes pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: It is generosity because it removes poverty, morality because it obtains coolness, patience because it endures anger, effort because it applies to the highest, meditation because it holds the mind, and wisdom because it knows the ultimate.

original: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pas na sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pas na sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is generosity because it removes poverty.

original: bsil ba 'thob par byed pas na tshul khrims te /
analyzed: bsil ba 'thob par byed pas na tshul khrims te /
translated: It is morality because it obtains coolness,

original: de dang ldan pa la yul gyi mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa la yul gyi mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who possesses it is without the torment of the passions aroused by the signs of objects.

original: khro ba bzod pa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa ste /🔽des khro ba bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro ba bzod pa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa ste / des khro ba bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is patience because it endures anger.

original: mchog dang sbyor bar byed pas na brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: mchog dang sbyor bar byed pas na brtson 'grus te /
translated: It is effort because it applies to the highest,

original: dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it applies to virtue.

original: yid nang du 'dzin par byed pas na bsam gtan no //
analyzed: yid nang du 'dzin par byed pas na bsam gtan no //
translated: It is meditation because it holds the mind.

original: 'dis ni don dam pa shes pas na shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam pa shes pas na shes rab bo //
translated: It is wisdom because it knows the ultimate.

original: sgom pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sgom pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of meditation

original: thams cad sgom pa dngos po dang // de bzhin yid la byed pa dang // bsam pa dang ni thabs dag dang // dbang 'byor nyid la brten par brjod //
analyzed: thams cad sgom pa dngos po dang // de bzhin yid la byed pa dang // bsam pa dang ni thabs dag dang // dbang 'byor nyid la brten par brjod //
translated: The perfection of the transcendences is based on things, and likewise on attention, aspiration, means, and mastery.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni dngos po la brten pa nas dbang @198b 'byor ba nyid la brten pa'i bar rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni dngos po la brten pa nas dbang @198b 'byor ba nyid la brten pa'i bar rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: The perfection of the transcendences is fivefold, based on things, and likewise based on attention, aspiration, means, and mastery.

original: de la dngos po la brten pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po la brten pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, based on things is also fourfold.

original: rgyu la brten pa ni rigs kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa goms pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la brten pa ni rigs kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa goms pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Based on cause is the practice of the transcendences through the power of lineage.

original: rnam par smin pa la brten pa ni lus phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la brten pa ni lus phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis gang yin pa'o //
translated: Based on result is the practice of the transcendences through the power of the perfection of the material body.

original: smon lam la brten pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis gang yin pa'o //🔽so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten pa ni /
analyzed: smon lam la brten pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis gang yin pa'o // so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten pa ni /
translated: Based on vow is the practice of the transcendences through the power of former vows.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa goms pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa goms pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Based on discernment is the practice of the transcendences through the power of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yid la byed pa la brten pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yid la byed pa la brten pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The attention of meditation on the transcendences is also fourfold, based on faith, enjoyment, delight, and aspiration.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde thams cad la mos pa yin no //🔽ro myang ba yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde thams cad la mos pa yin no // ro myang ba yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The attention of faith is faith in all the scriptures that deal with the transcendences.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa dag la yon tan du lta ba'i tshul gyis ro myong bar byed pa yin no //🔽rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa dag la yon tan du lta ba'i tshul gyis ro myong bar byed pa yin no // rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The attention of enjoyment is the enjoyment of the transcendences already attained, as if they were nectar.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba yin no //🔽mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba yin no // mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The attention of delight is the delight in the special transcendences of all beings in all universes.

original: bdag nyid dang sems can thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang sems can thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
translated: The attention of aspiration is the aspiration to attain the transcendences not yet attained.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa bsam pa la brten pa ni rnam pa drug ste ;
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa bsam pa la brten pa ni rnam pa drug ste ;
translated: The attention of meditation on the transcendences is sixfold, based on will.

original: ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / rgya chen po'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang / ma gos pa'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / rgya chen po'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang / ma gos pa'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The attitude of contentment, the attitude of vast extent, the attitude of joy, the attitude of benefit, the attitude of non defilement, and the attitude of virtue.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas attitude of contentment in generosity is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig la yang skad cig ma gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ba dang / lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig la yang skad cig ma gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ba dang / lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed sbyin par byed cing /
translated: In a single instant, a bodhisattva gives to a single sentient being as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river, each of which is filled with as many worlds as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river, all of them filled with the seven kinds of precious substances.

original: de bzhin du bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du skad cig ma re re la sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du skad cig ma re re la sbyin par byed la /
translated: And he gives in this way in every instant for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: sems can gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sems can gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: And just as he does this for a single sentient being,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya ba'i sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa de dag la rnam grangs 'dis sbyin par byed kyang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i bsam pa la ngoms pa med pa nyid gang yin🔽pa ste / bsam @199a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya ba'i sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa de dag la rnam grangs 'dis sbyin par byed kyang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i bsam pa la ngoms pa med pa nyid gang yin pa ste / bsam @199a * //
translated: Even if a bodhisattva were to give to all those realms of sentient beings who are ready to be brought to maturity for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, a bodhisattva would still not be satisfied with the thought of giving.

original: pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: Whatever that thought is, that is a bodhisattva’s insatiable thought of giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa brgyud pa de lta bu yang skad cig tsam yang nyams par mi byed cing byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyun gcod par mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa brgyud pa de lta bu yang skad cig tsam yang nyams par mi byed cing byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyun gcod par mi byed de /
translated: A bodhisattva does not let that kind of continuity of giving lapse for even a moment, and does not interrupt it until sitting on the seat of awakening.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la rgya chen po'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la rgya chen po'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: Whatever that thought is, that is a bodhisattva’s magnanimous thought of giving.

original: sems can de dag de ltar sbyin pas rjes su 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: sems can de dag de ltar sbyin pas rjes su 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Those sentient beings are looked after by that kind of giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva will be even more pleased.

original: sbyin pa des rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa des rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is much more pleased than those beings who are helped by that generosity.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la dga' ba'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la dga' ba'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s magnanimous attitude toward generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang dag la de ltar sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag bdag nyid la ches phan 'dogs pa yin par yang dag par rjes su lta bltar bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang dag la de ltar sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag bdag nyid la ches phan 'dogs pa yin par yang dag par rjes su lta bltar bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva regards those beings whom he or she helps by means of generosity as being much more helpful to him or her than him or herself,

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they reveal unsurpassed complete enlightenment.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la phan pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la phan pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s beneficial attitude toward generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams las de ltar sbyin pa las byung pa'i bsod nams rgya chen po mngon par 'dus byas kyang lan dang rnam par smin pa don du gnyer ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams las de ltar sbyin pa las byung pa'i bsod nams rgya chen po mngon par 'dus byas kyang lan dang rnam par smin pa don du gnyer ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Although bodhisattvas have thus created great merit from generosity, they do not seek a reward or its evolutionary development.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la ma gos pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la ma gos pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: This kind of aspiration is the bodhisattvas unattached aspiration in cultivating the transcendence of generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i phung po de ltar rgya che ba'i rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de yang sems can rnams kho na la 'dor gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i phung po de ltar rgya che ba'i rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de yang sems can rnams kho na la 'dor gyi /
translated: The bodhisattvas give away to all beings the evolutionary development of that great mass of generosity,

original: bdag nyid la ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni ma yin zhing /
translated: and not to themselves.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang yongs su sngo bar byed de //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang yongs su sngo bar byed de //
translated: Having made it common to all beings, they dedicate it to complete knowing.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dge ba'i bsam pa yin no //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dge ba'i bsam pa yin no // de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: Such an attitude is the bodhisattva's virtuous attitude in cultivating the perfection of generosity.🔽In this regard, the insatiable attitude in cultivating the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye @199b ma snyed kyis tshe'i chad bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du rtag par yo byad thams cad
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye @199b ma snyed kyis tshe'i chad bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du rtag par yo byad thams cad
translated: A bodhisattva, for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, with a body giving rise to all the necessities of life,

original: kyis phongs bzhin du /
analyzed: kyis phongs bzhin du /
translated: even while lacking all the necessities,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me mar mur gyis rab tu gang bar spyod lam rnam pa bzhi byed cing /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me mar mur gyis rab tu gang bar spyod lam rnam pa bzhi byed cing /
translated: in a great trichiliocosm filled with the fire of the end of an eon, engages in the four types of conduct,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skad cig ma gcig nas ;
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skad cig ma gcig nas ;
translated: and in a single moment of the perfection of morality up to

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skad cig ma gcig gi bar sgom par byed cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skad cig ma gcig gi bar sgom par byed cing /
translated: They meditate on the perfection of wisdom for a single instant.

original: rnam grangs des gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po ji snyed pa nas shes rab kyi phung po ji snyed pa'i bar gyi tshul khrims kyi phung po nas shes
analyzed: rnam grangs des gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po ji snyed pa nas shes rab kyi phung po ji snyed pa'i bar gyi tshul khrims kyi phung po nas shes
translated: By this method, they meditate on the aggregate of morality up to the aggregate of wisdom, however much is necessary to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab kyi phung po'i bar de sgom par byed kyang byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bsam pa nas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bsam pa'i bar la ngoms pa med pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab kyi phung po'i bar de sgom par byed kyang byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bsam pa nas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bsam pa'i bar la ngoms pa med pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: But the bodhisattvas are not satisfied with the thought of meditating on the perfection of morality up to the thought of meditating on the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa nas /
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa nas /
translated: Whatever that thought is, that is the bodhisattvas’ thought of being insatiable with regard to meditating on the perfection of morality up to meditating on the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin bsgom pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam ba'i bar yin no //🔽'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa brgyud pa nas ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin bsgom pa la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam ba'i bar yin no // 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa brgyud pa nas ;
translated: and the thought of being insatiable in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.🔽Thus, the bodhisattva does not abandon the cultivation of the perfection of morality,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa brgyud pa'i bar de mi gtong zhing byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyud gcod par mi byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa brgyud pa'i bar de mi gtong zhing byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyud gcod par mi byed do //
translated: and so on up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, until he sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva's magnanimous thought in the cultivation of the perfection of morality,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la rgya chen po'i bsam pa yin no //🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la rgya chen po'i bsam pa yin no // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas //
translated: and so on up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattva's thought of embracing sentient beings through the cultivation of the perfection of morality,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar des sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar des sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin pa na /
translated: and so on up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom,🔽is the thought of embracing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ches dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva will be even more pleased.

original: rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /🔽bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: rjes su bzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te / bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: The bodhisattva is much more pleased than those beings who are helped.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar dag la dga' ba'i bsam pa yin no //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang dag la de ltar tshul khrims @200a * //🔽kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar dag la dga' ba'i bsam pa yin no // byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang dag la de ltar tshul khrims @200a * // kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: This is the kind of thought that is the thought of delight in the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar gyis phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag bdag nyid la ches phan 'dogs pa yin par yang dag par rjes su lta ba ltar bdag nyid la ni ma yin to /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar gyis phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag bdag nyid la ches phan 'dogs pa yin par yang dag par rjes su lta ba ltar bdag nyid la ni ma yin to /
translated: The bodhisattva regards those beings who are helped by the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom as doing him a great favor, but not himself.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye bar rton pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye bar rton pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the ones who are close to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: Such an attitude is the bodhisattva's cultivation of the transcendence of morality.🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar gyis phan pa'i bsam pa yin no //🔽byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar gyis phan pa'i bsam pa yin no // byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nas /
translated: Such an intention is the bodhisattva's beneficial intention in the practice of the transcendence of morality up to the practice of the transcendence of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i bar gyi bsod nams rgya chen po mngon par 'dus byas kyang lan dang rnam par smin pa don du gnyer ba yang ma yin te //🔽bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i bar gyi bsod nams rgya chen po mngon par 'dus byas kyang lan dang rnam par smin pa don du gnyer ba yang ma yin te // bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having thus created great merit through the practice of the transcendence of morality up to the practice of the transcendence of wisdom, does not seek a reward or its evolutionary development.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la ma gos pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la ma gos pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: Such an intention is the bodhisattva's unsoiled intention in the practice of the transcendence of morality up to the practice of the transcendence of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las byung ba nas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms ba las byung ba'i bar gyi bsod nams kyi phung po de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de yang sems can rnams kho na la 'dar gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las byung ba nas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms ba las byung ba'i bar gyi bsod nams kyi phung po de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de yang sems can rnams kho na la 'dar gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva dedicates the mass of merit that arises from cultivating the perfection of ethical discipline and so on up to the mass of merit that arises from cultivating the perfection of wisdom to sentient beings alone and not to himself.🔽🔽

original: bdag nyid la ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni ma yin zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva dedicates the mass of merit that arises from cultivating the perfection of morality, up to the mass of merit that arises from cultivating the perfection of wisdom, not for his own sake,🔽but for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
translated: He makes it common to all sentient beings and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang yongs su sngo bar byed da /🔽bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang yongs su sngo bar byed da / bsam pa de lta bu gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la dge ba'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la dge ba'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: This kind of aspiration is the virtuous aspiration of the bodhisattva for cultivating the perfection of morality, up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa thabs la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa thabs la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Cultivation of the perfections in dependence on means is threefold:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis /
translated: By the nondiscriminating intuition,

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par so sor rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par so sor rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: because of the discrimination of the three cycles as completely pure.

original: 'di ltar thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that method is the accomplishment of all mental orientations.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dbang 'byor pa nyid la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dbang 'byor pa nyid la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cultivation of the transcendences in terms of mastery is threefold:

original: sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / ston pa la dbang @200b 'byor ba nyid do //
analyzed: sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / ston pa la dbang @200b 'byor ba nyid do //
translated: mastery over body, mastery over activity, and mastery over teaching.

original: de la sku la dbang 'byor ba nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis po ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par blta bar bya'o //🔽de la spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de la sku la dbang 'byor ba nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis po ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par blta bar bya'o // de la spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni /
translated: Among these, mastery over body should be recognized as the two bodies of the Tathāgata, the essential body and the beatific body.

original: sprul pa'i sku yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Among these, mastery over activity should be recognized as the emanation body.

original: des ni sems can thams cad la chos dang mthun pa'i spyod pa rnam pa thams cad ston par byed do //
analyzed: des ni sems can thams cad la chos dang mthun pa'i spyod pa rnam pa thams cad ston par byed do //
translated: By that, he manifests all kinds of activities in accord with the Dharma for all sentient beings.🔽Mastery over teaching is the power of knowledge of the termination of taints.

original: ston pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni /
analyzed: ston pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni /
translated: Mastery of the teacher is

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnam pa thams cad ston pa la thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnam pa thams cad ston pa la thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: the unimpeded demonstration of all aspects of the six perfections.

original: rab tu dbye ba bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are twelve verses summarizing the analysis,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa so sor don drug tu rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa so sor don drug tu rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because each of the six transcendences is analyzed under six topics.

original: don drug ni ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang / ldan pa dang / 'jug pa'i don rnams so //
analyzed: don drug ni ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang / ldan pa dang / 'jug pa'i don rnams so //
translated: The six topics are nature, cause, effect, activity, endowment, and function.🔽Two verses on the analysis of generosity.🔽Generosity is considered great

analyzed: de la sbyin ba'i rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: through its basis, its nature,🔽its resources, its attainment,🔽its endowment, and its function.🔽Generosity is considered great🔽through its basis, its nature,🔽its resources, its attainment,🔽its endowment, and its function.🔽Generosity is considered great🔽through its basis, its nature,🔽its resources, its attainment,🔽its endowment, and its function.🔽Generosity is considered great🔽through its basis, its nature,🔽its resources, its attainment,🔽its endowment, and its function.🔽Generosity is considered great🔽through its basis, its nature,🔽its resources, its attainment,🔽its endowment, and its function.🔽Generosity is considered great

original: don rnams gtong bar byed pa dang // rtsa ba sems pa la brten dang // lus dang longs spyod phun tshogs dang // gnyis rjes 'dzin dang rdzogs byed dang // de yang ser sna med ldan dang // chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs gtong //
analyzed: don rnams gtong bar byed pa dang // rtsa ba sems pa la brten dang // lus dang longs spyod phun tshogs dang // gnyis rjes 'dzin dang rdzogs byed dang // de yang ser sna med ldan dang // chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs gtong //
translated: through its basis, its nature,

original: sbyin pa de 'drar yongs shes nas //
analyzed: sbyin pa de 'drar yongs shes nas //
translated: its resources, its attainment,🔽its endowment, and its function.

original: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
translated: Generosity is considered great🔽through its basis, its nature,🔽its resources, its attainment,🔽its endowment, and its function.

original: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni len pa po rnams la don gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni len pa po rnams la don gtong ba'o //
translated: The nature of generosity is the giving of objects to those who request them.

original: rgyu ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the will that is innate or associated with nonattachment.

original: 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni /
translated: Its result is

original: lus phun sum tshogs pa tshe la sogs pas bsdus pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus phun sum tshogs pa tshe la sogs pas bsdus pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: the perfection of the body, included in life, etc. , and the perfection of resources.

original: gnas lnga'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas lnga'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is according to the Sutra on the Five Points.

original: las ni / rang dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa dang / byang chub chen po'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las ni / rang dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa dang / byang chub chen po'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Its action is to nourish oneself and others and to perfect the stores that lead to enlightenment.

original: ldan pa ni //
analyzed: ldan pa ni //
translated: It is associated with

original: ser sna med pa dang ste /
analyzed: ser sna med pa dang ste /
translated: nonmiserliness.

original: ser sna med pa dag la yod do //
analyzed: ser sna med pa dag la yod do //
translated: It exists for those who are not miserly.

original: 'jug pa ni chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i rab tu dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i rab tu dbye bas so //
translated: Its activity is the classification of generosity as the giving of Dharma, material goods, and protection.

original: tshul khrims kyi rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of morality

original: yan lag drug zhi bsam pas zin //
analyzed: yan lag drug zhi bsam pas zin //
translated: It is held to have six aspects, to be peaceful, and to be imbued with the intention to benefit.🔽It gives the attainment of happy states and the support of patience,

original: bde 'gro gnas pa sbyin byed dang // rten dang zhi dang 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: bde 'gro gnas pa sbyin byed dang // rten dang zhi dang 'jigs pa med //
translated: and it is the basis of peace and fearlessness.

original: bsod nams tshogs dang ldan pa dang // brdar btags chos nyid thob pa ste //
analyzed: bsod nams tshogs dang ldan pa dang // brdar btags chos nyid thob pa ste //
translated: the conventional and the attained through realization,

original: sdom pa gnas pa rnams la yod //
analyzed: sdom pa gnas pa rnams la yod //
translated: it exists for those who maintain the vow.

original: tshul khrims de 'drar yongs shes nas //
analyzed: tshul khrims de 'drar yongs shes nas //
translated: Knowing that morality is like that,

original: mkhas pa @201a * //
analyzed: mkhas pa @201a * //
translated: the wise

original: yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub par byed //
translated: practice it correctly.

original: yan lag drug ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag drug ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The six limbs are its essence.🔽The six limbs are:🔽abiding in morality,

original: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa nas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la yang dag par blangs te /🔽slob pa zhes bya ba'i bar yin no /
analyzed: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa nas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la yang dag par blangs te / slob pa zhes bya ba'i bar yin no /
translated: and training in the bases of training.🔽The cause is said to be:

original: zhi ba'i bsam pas zin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu ste ;
analyzed: zhi ba'i bsam pas zin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu ste ;
translated: being imbued with the thought of peace,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas yang dag par len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas yang dag par len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one undertakes it with the thought of nirvana.

original: bde 'gro gnas pa sbyin byed dang // zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro gnas pa sbyin byed dang // zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: It is said to be the giver of the abode of good destiny,

original: tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because through morality one goes to good destinies, and because one attains the stilling of the mind through the stages of non-remorse and so on.

original: rten dang zhi dang 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: rten dang zhi dang 'jigs pa med //
translated: It is the basis, peace, and fearlessness.

original: ces bya ba ni las te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni las te /
translated: This is its function.

original: tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin no //
translated: Morality is the basis of all good qualities.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it pacifies the burning of the afflictions.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen can gyi rten 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho pa dang / kho na rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen can gyi rten 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho pa dang / kho na rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa'o ;
translated: It is fearlessness because it prevents the occurrence of the fear, the reproach, and the enmity that are conditioned by the taking of life, etc.🔽It is endowed with the accumulation of merit.

original: / bsod nams tshogs dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni ldan pa ste /
analyzed: / bsod nams tshogs dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni ldan pa ste /
translated: This is its endowment.

original: dus thams cad du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yang dag par kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yang dag par kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is always endowed with the right activity of body, speech, and mind.

original: brdar btags chos nyid thob pa ste //
analyzed: brdar btags chos nyid thob pa ste //
translated: It is conventional and real.

original: sdom la gnas pa rnams la yod //
analyzed: sdom la gnas pa rnams la yod //
translated: It exists for those who are established in the vow.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jug pa ste /
translated: This is its engagement.

original: de la brdar btags pas thob pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la brdar btags pas thob pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is conventional when it is obtained through the vow of individual liberation.

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: That which is obtained by its very nature is included in the meditative concentrations and the uncontaminated vows.

analyzed: bzod pa rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te / mi mjed ji mi snyam shes dang // snying rjes chos la brten pa'i phyir //

analyzed: phan yon lngar ni yang dag bshad //
translated: . It is taught that patience has five benefits:🔽from the tolerance of others' violence, from the tolerance of the practice of austerities, from the tolerance of accepting suffering, from the tolerance of certitude in the Dharma, and from the tolerance of the transmutation into something else of what was thought to be violence.

original: de ni gnyis kyi don byed do //
analyzed: de ni gnyis kyi don byed do //

original: dka' thub gtso dang kun tu ldan //

original: de la de ni rnam gsum 'dod //

original: bzod pa de 'drar yongs shes nas //
analyzed: bzod pa de 'drar yongs shes nas //

original: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //

analyzed: mi mjed ji mi snyam shes dang // zhes bya ba ni bzod pa rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The tolerance of others' violence, the tolerance of the practice of austerities, and the tolerance of accepting suffering are the three kinds of patience.

original: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ni mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ni mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ste /

original: mi @201b 'thing ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi @201b 'thing ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Patience of non-anger is the patience of non-anger, because one is not angry.

original: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang go rims bzhin no //

original: snying rjes chos la brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snying rjes chos la brten pa'i phyir //

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu ste /

original: phan yon ldar ni yang dag bshad //
analyzed: phan yon ldar ni yang dag bshad //

original: ces bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /

original: ji skad du /

analyzed: dbye na mi mang ba yin /

analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba mang ba yin /

analyzed: de ni gnyis kyi don byed de //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi mjed pa dang / ji mi snyam pa dang / shes pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //

original: ji skad du /

original: ji skad du /

analyzed: de la de ni zhes bya ba ni rten gyis 'jug pa'o //

original: rnam gsum 'dod ces bya ba ni //
analyzed: rnam gsum 'dod ces bya ba ni //

analyzed: rab tu dbye bas 'jug pa ste //

analyzed: shes rab can dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is engaged by the wise.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gsum gyis 'jug pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dman pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chen po'o //🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa so so'i @203a * //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gsum gyis 'jug pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dman pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chen po'o // sbyin pa la sogs pa so so'i @203a * //
translated: It is engaged in three ways, as mundane, as lower supramundane, and as higher supramundane.

original: don drug tu rab tu phye bas rab tu dbye ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: don drug tu rab tu phye bas rab tu dbye ba bshad zin to /
translated: The divisions of generosity and so forth have been explained in terms of their six aims.

original: // / bsub  rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: // / bsub  rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the types of generosity

original: dkar po'i chos kun rnam par g-yengs pa dang // mnyam par gzhag dang gnyis kar shes par bya //🔽pha rol phyin pa gnyis dang ni //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kun rnam par g-yengs pa dang // mnyam par gzhag dang gnyis kar shes par bya // pha rol phyin pa gnyis dang ni //
translated: All the virtuous practices should be understood as distracted, concentrated, and both.

original: gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bsdus //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bsdus //
translated: They are included in two perfections each.

original: dkar po'i chos kun ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kun ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the virtuous practices are generosity, etc.

original: de la rnam par g-yengs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gnyis kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: de la rnam par g-yengs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gnyis kyis bsdus te /
translated: Among them, the distracted are included in the first two perfections,

original: sbyin pa dang yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because generosity and morality in the form of proper conduct are not concentrated.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa ni phyi ma gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa ni phyi ma gnyis kyis te /
translated: The concentrated are included in the last two perfections,

original: bsam gtan dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because meditative absorption and wisdom are concentrated.

original: gnyis ka ste mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: gnyis ka ste mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyis bsdus te /
translated: Both the concentrated and the distracted are included in two perfections,🔽because patience and vigor are both concentrated and distracted.

original: bzod pa dang ; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfections of patience and effort are both meditative and non-meditative.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
translated: Six verses on the analysis of the resistances to the transcendences.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni //🔽ma chags mi chags chags pa med //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni // ma chags mi chags chags pa med //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattvas

original: chags pa nyid kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: chags pa nyid kyang ma yin te //
translated: is not attached, not attached, not attached,🔽not attached, not attached, not attached,

original: ma chags mi chags chags pa med //🔽chags pa rnam pa bdun ni /
analyzed: ma chags mi chags chags pa med // chags pa rnam pa bdun ni /
translated: not attached, not attached, and not attached.

original: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: There are seven kinds of attachment that are resistances to generosity:

original: longs spyod la chags pa dang / bshol pa la chags pa dang / de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa la chags pa dang / len la re pa la chags pa dang / rnam par smin pa la chags pa dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa dang /
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa dang / bshol pa la chags pa dang / de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa la chags pa dang / len la re pa la chags pa dang / rnam par smin pa la chags pa dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa dang /
translated: attachment to wealth, attachment to relaxation, attachment to the fruits of generosity, attachment to reciprocation, attachment to evolutionary development, attachment to the resistances, and attachment to the result.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba la chags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba la chags pa'o //
translated: and attachment to distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that distraction is of two kinds:

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni theg pa dman pa la dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni theg pa dman pa la dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: distraction of mental activity, because of delight in the Individual Vehicle;

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni sbyin pa po dang / len pa po dang / sbyin par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni sbyin pa po dang / len pa po dang / sbyin par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and distraction of conceptualization, because of conceptualizing the giver, the gift, and the receiver.

original: de bas na chags pa rnam pa bdun las grol ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i ma chags pa nyid lan @203b bdun bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na chags pa rnam pa bdun las grol ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i ma chags pa nyid lan @203b bdun bshad do //
translated: Therefore, because of being free from seven kinds of attachment, nonattachment in generosity is explained as sevenfold.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva

analyzed: ma chags mi chags chags pa med //

analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa la ma chags pa bshad pa ltar tshul khrims nas shes rab kyi bar la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as generosity is explained as being without attachment, so too should morality up to wisdom be understood as being without attachment.

analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yod de /

analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa'i skyin par 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa la chags pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: that in place of attachment to wealth, attachment to immorality and so on should be mentioned.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment to the adverse side is because the latent states of the adverse side have not been completely conquered.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni ci rigs par 'khor gsum du rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni ci rigs par 'khor gsum du rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Distraction of conceptualization is because of conceptualizing the three spheres, as appropriate.

original: yon tan rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum ste //
analyzed: yon tan rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum ste //
translated: Twenty-three verses on the analysis of the virtues

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams slong dang phrad na rang gi srog kyang rtag tu gtong //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams slong dang phrad na rang gi srog kyang rtag tu gtong //
translated: . The buddhas’ offspring, when they encounter beggars, always give even at the sacrifice of their own lives.

original: snying rjes gzhan las lan kyang mi re 'dod pa'i 'bras bu don mi gnyer //
analyzed: snying rjes gzhan las lan kyang mi re 'dod pa'i 'bras bu don mi gnyer //
translated: Out of compassion, they do not hope for a reward, nor do they seek a desirable karmic maturation.

original: sbyin pa de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: sbyin pa de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: By that very generosity they establish all beings in the three enlightenments.🔽Generosity, being held by the wisdom that knows it is without intrinsic reality, is established in the world as inexhaustible.

original: sbyin pa ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i tshig gi don ni go bar sla'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i tshig gi don ni go bar sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams sdom dang brtson pa'i rang bzhin tshul khrims gsum rtag blangs //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams sdom dang brtson pa'i rang bzhin tshul khrims gsum rtag blangs //
translated: The Conqueror's sons always take up the three moralities, whose nature is restraint and exertion.

original: mtho ris mngon par mi 'dod yang dag thob kyang de la chags mi bskyed //
analyzed: mtho ris mngon par mi 'dod yang dag thob kyang de la chags mi bskyed //
translated: Even though they do not desire rebirth, they do not become attached to it when they attain it.

original: tshul khrims de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: tshul khrims de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: By means of that morality, they establish all beings in the three enlightenments.

original: tshul khrims ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig @204a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig @204a * //
translated: Because morality is possessed by intuition, it is established as inexhaustible in the worlds.

original: rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: The three moralities are the morality of restraint, the morality of gathering virtuous natures, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'di rnams las gcig ni sdom pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams las gcig ni sdom pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: One of these has the nature of restraint;

original: gnyis ni brtson pa'i rang bzhin yin no //🔽sangs rgyas sras rnams shin tu bya dka' de bzhin mi yi gnod kun bzod //
analyzed: gnyis ni brtson pa'i rang bzhin yin no // sangs rgyas sras rnams shin tu bya dka' de bzhin mi yi gnod kun bzod //
translated: two have the nature of exertion.

original: mtho ris gnyer dang mi nus pas min 'jigs pas ma yin phan ltas min //
analyzed: mtho ris gnyer dang mi nus pas min 'jigs pas ma yin phan ltas min //
translated: The Buddha's sons are patient with all the harm that people do, even though it be very difficult, and not for the sake of reward, or from impotence, or from fear, or from hope of return.

original: bzod pa bla na med pas skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: bzod pa bla na med pas skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: Through unexcelled patience, he establishes all beings in the three enlightenments.

original: bzod pa ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bzod pa ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Patience, being taken hold of by pristine wisdom, is placed in the worlds as inexhaustible.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams go cha sbyor ba'i bdag nyid brtson 'grus dpe med byas //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams go cha sbyor ba'i bdag nyid brtson 'grus dpe med byas //
translated: The victors’ spiritual heirs, with their incomparable diligence, which is armored and applied,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs tshogs gzhom byang chub dam pa 'thob par byed //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs tshogs gzhom byang chub dam pa 'thob par byed //
translated: destroy the hosts of afflictions of self and others and attain sublime enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: brtson 'grus de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: Through that very diligence, they establish all beings in the three enlightenments.

original: brtson 'grus ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus yin no //
translated: Diligence, being taken hold of by pristine wisdom, is placed in the worlds as inexhaustible.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams ting 'dzin mang ldan bsam gtan rnam pa thams cad bsgrubs //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams ting 'dzin mang ldan bsam gtan rnam pa thams cad bsgrubs //
translated: The Conqueror’s sons, endowed with many meditative concentrations, accomplish all the aspects of meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan bde ba phul gyis gnas shing snying rjes skye ba dman la brten //
analyzed: bsam gtan bde ba phul gyis gnas shing snying rjes skye ba dman la brten //
translated: They abide in the highest bliss of meditative concentration, and through compassion, they take birth in the lower realms.

original: bsam gtan de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: bsam gtan de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: And through that meditative concentration, they establish all beings in the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: bsam gtan ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ye shes kyis yongs zin pas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la /
translated: And because their meditative concentration is imbued with gnosis, they remain in the world without being exhausted.

original: ting nge 'dzin mang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Endowed with many meditative concentrations refers to

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas’ meditative concentration, which is included in the infinite bodhisattva concentrations.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams de nyid shes bya gang yin mtha' dag rnam kun shes //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams de nyid shes bya gang yin mtha' dag rnam kun shes //
translated: The Conqueror’s sons know all there is to be known in every way.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang blo yis chags rab ma bskyed 'khor bar smos ci dgos //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang blo yis chags rab ma bskyed 'khor bar smos ci dgos //
translated: They do not even mentally cling to nirvana, let alone to samsara.

original: ye shes de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: ye shes de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: And through that gnosis, they establish all beings in the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: ye shes sems can yongs su bzung bas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pas bsdus pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag dang / chos la @204b bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems can yongs su bzung bas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pas bsdus pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag dang / chos la @204b bdag med pa'o //
translated: That itself refers to the selflessness of persons and of phenomena, which is the general characteristic subsumed by the ultimate.

original: shes bya gang yin pa mtha' dag rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba ni rang gi brda la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba mtha' yas pas tha dad pa'i shes bya gzhan gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: shes bya gang yin pa mtha' dag rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba ni rang gi brda la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba mtha' yas pas tha dad pa'i shes bya gzhan gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: All that is to be known in every way refers to all that is to be known, which is differentiated by the endless categories of its own symbols and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pas mi zad pa nyid de ;
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pas mi zad pa nyid de ;
translated: Generosity and so on are inexhaustible because they are maintained by nonconceptual pristine wisdom,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not exhausted even in the nirvana without remainder.

original: ye shes ni sems can yongs su bzung bas mi zad pa nyid de /
analyzed: ye shes ni sems can yongs su bzung bas mi zad pa nyid de /
translated: Pristine wisdom is inexhaustible because of the retention of sentient beings,

original: snying rjes sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rjes sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the nonabandonment of sentient beings through compassion.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug po 'di rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don ni tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa //🔽rgya che ba dang zang zing med //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa drug po 'di rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don ni tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa // rgya che ba dang zang zing med //
translated: The condensed meaning of these six verses is stated in the seventh verse.🔽Generosity and so forth are to be known🔽as the basis of the virtues🔽of greatness, nonmateriality,

original: don che ba dang mi zad pa //🔽sbyin la sogs pa thams cad kyi //🔽yon tan gzhir ni shes par bya //🔽zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: don che ba dang mi zad pa // sbyin la sogs pa thams cad kyi // yon tan gzhir ni shes par bya // zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: great meaning, and inexhaustibility.

original: de la rtsa ba dang pos ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgya che ba nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba dang pos ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgya che ba nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: The first root teaches the greatness of generosity and so forth.

original: gnyis pas ni zang zing med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni zang zing med pa nyid do //
translated: The second teaches their nonmateriality.

original: gsum pas ni don chen po nyid de //
analyzed: gsum pas ni don chen po nyid de //
translated: The third teaches their great meaning,

original: sems can gyi don chen po sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don chen po sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they accomplish the great meaning of sentient beings.

original: bzhi pas ni mi zad pa nyid de /
analyzed: bzhi pas ni mi zad pa nyid de /
translated: The fourth teaches their inexhaustibility.

original: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis de rnams kyi yon tan bzhir rig par bya'o //🔽slong ba mthong rdzogs dga' ba dang // mi dga' ba dang smon pa yang ;
analyzed: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis de rnams kyi yon tan bzhir rig par bya'o // slong ba mthong rdzogs dga' ba dang // mi dga' ba dang smon pa yang ;
translated: Thus, their four virtues should be understood through these verses.

original: / sbyin pa po ni brtser ldan pas //
analyzed: / sbyin pa po ni brtser ldan pas //
translated: The giver who is full of love

original: lhag par ldan pas rtag zil gnon //
analyzed: lhag par ldan pas rtag zil gnon //
translated: always surpasses the miser🔽in seeing, completing, and wishing for🔽the sight of the poor and their satisfaction.

original: slong ba po'i skye bo la sbyin pa po mthong ba dang / de las ci 'dod pa thob pas yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pas dga' ba gang yin pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pas mi dga' ba dang /🔽de mthong ba dang / yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par smon pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' la dus thams cad du slong ba po mthong ba dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: slong ba po'i skye bo la sbyin pa po mthong ba dang / de las ci 'dod pa thob pas yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pas dga' ba gang yin pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pas mi dga' ba dang / de mthong ba dang / yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par smon pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' la dus thams cad du slong ba po mthong ba dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
translated: The joy that a giver feels when he sees a petitioner and when his wishes are fulfilled by receiving whatever he wants, and the sorrow he feels when he does not see a petitioner or when his wishes are not fulfilled.

original: ma mthong ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pas lhag par skye ste ;
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pas lhag par skye ste ;
translated: The bodhisattva always feels greater joy when he sees a petitioner and when his wishes are fulfilled, and greater sorrow when he does not see a petitioner or when his wishes are not fulfilled.

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa po brtse ba dang ldan pas lhag par ldan pa'i sgo nas de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa po brtse ba dang ldan pas lhag par ldan pa'i sgo nas de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Therefore, the compassionate giver surpasses all others in generosity.

original: brtse bas sems can rnams la ni //
analyzed: brtse bas sems can rnams la ni //
translated: The compassionate one always gives to sentient beings

original: srog dang longs spyod chung ma dag / rtag gtong shin tu dga' byed pa //
analyzed: srog dang longs spyod chung ma dag / rtag gtong shin tu dga' byed pa //
translated: his life, wealth, and spouse, and he does so with the greatest joy.

original: de spang ji ltar srung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de spang ji ltar srung mi 'gyur //
translated: How could one who has abandoned that be one who does not observe morality?

original: de dag spong ba @205a * //🔽ni de spang ba ste//
analyzed: de dag spong ba @205a * // ni de spang ba ste//
translated: Abandoning those

original: gzhan gyi srog dang longs spyod dang chung ma dag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog dang longs spyod dang chung ma dag go //
translated: means abandoning the taking of life, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct.

original: 'dis ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum las ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi yon tan ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum las ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi yon tan ston to //
translated: This shows the virtue of morality that turns away from the three kinds of physical misconduct.

original: 'phags pa mi lta sems snyoms shing //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi lta sems snyoms shing //
translated: The noble are impartial,

original: mi 'jigs brtse phyir kun ster ba //🔽gzhan la gnod par byed pa yi //
analyzed: mi 'jigs brtse phyir kun ster ba // gzhan la gnod par byed pa yi //
translated: give everything out of fearlessness and compassion.🔽How could they utter

original: log pa'i tshig ni ji ltar smra //
analyzed: log pa'i tshig ni ji ltar smra //
translated: false speech that injures others?

original: 'dis ni brdzun du smra ba las log pa'i yon tan ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni brdzun du smra ba las log pa'i yon tan ston te /
translated: This shows the virtue of turning away from false speech.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: False speech is used for one’s own sake,

original: lus dang srog la lta bas sam /
analyzed: lus dang srog la lta bas sam /
translated: out of concern for one’s body and life,

original: skye bo gzhan gyi phyir te /
analyzed: skye bo gzhan gyi phyir te /
translated: or for the sake of others,

original: skye bo mdza' ba la byams pas sam /
analyzed: skye bo mdza' ba la byams pas sam /
translated: out of love for one’s friends,

original: 'jigs pas te /🔽rgyal po la sogs pas skrag pas sam //
analyzed: 'jigs pas te / rgyal po la sogs pas skrag pas sam //
translated: or out of fear,🔽out of fear of a king, etc.,

original: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir te /
analyzed: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir te /
translated: or for the sake of a little wealth,

original: rnyed pa'i don du smra bar 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i don du smra bar 'gyur grang na //
translated: in order to obtain some profit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / bdag nyid dang snyoms pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa dang / 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / bdag nyid dang snyoms pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa dang / 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir /
translated: Bodhisattvas have no regard for their own bodies and lives, they have an attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings with a mind of sameness with themselves, they are fearless because they have transcended the five fears and they are givers of everything to beggars because they give away all their possessions.

original: slong ba po rnam pa thams cad ster ba yin na de rgyu gang gis brdzun du smra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: slong ba po rnam pa thams cad ster ba yin na de rgyu gang gis brdzun du smra bar 'gyur /
translated: For what reason would they lie?🔽They are impartial, wishing to help,

original: snyoms par phan par 'dod pa brtse ba can //
analyzed: snyoms par phan par 'dod pa brtse ba can //
translated: and full of love.

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal skye bas shin tu 'jigs //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal skye bas shin tu 'jigs //
translated: They are terrified of the arising of others’ suffering.

original: sems can gdul ba la ni legs brtson pa //
analyzed: sems can gdul ba la ni legs brtson pa //
translated: They are well trained in guiding sentient beings.

original: dag gi nyes rnam gsum las shin tu ring //
analyzed: dag gi nyes rnam gsum las shin tu ring //
translated: They are far removed from the three verbal nonvirtues.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la snyoms par phan par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la snyoms par phan par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: Bodhisattvas are impartial and wish to help all sentient beings.

original: de ji ltar gzhan dag la bshes pa dbye ba'i phyir phra ma byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar gzhan dag la bshes pa dbye ba'i phyir phra ma byed par 'gyur /
translated: So how could they engage in divisive speech in order to split the affection of others?

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir brtse ba can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal skye bas shin tu 'jigs pa yang yin na /🔽de ji ltar gzhan dag la sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir brtse ba can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal skye bas shin tu 'jigs pa yang yin na / de ji ltar gzhan dag la sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: He is compassionate, because he has the intention to remove the suffering of others. He is terrified of the suffering of others.

original: tshig rtsub mos smra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshig rtsub mos smra bar 'gyur /
translated: How could he speak harshly to others in order to cause them suffering?

original: sems can rnams gdul ba la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa yang yin na /
analyzed: sems can rnams gdul ba la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa yang yin na /
translated: He is also truly and fully engaged in the training of sentient beings.

original: de ji ltar tshig kyal pa smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji ltar tshig kyal pa smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could he speak frivolously?

original: de lta bas na 'di ni ngag gnyis pa rnam pa gsum po phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa las shin tu ring ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni ngag gnyis pa rnam pa gsum po phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa las shin tu ring ba yin no //
translated: Thus, he is far removed from the three verbal nonvirtues: divisive speech, harsh speech, and frivolous speech.

original: thams cad gtong ba snying rje can //
analyzed: thams cad gtong ba snying rje can //
translated: He is compassionate, giving everything.

original: rten 'byung chos la rab mkhas pa //
analyzed: rten 'byung chos la rab mkhas pa //
translated: He is skilled in the Dharma of dependent origination.🔽How could he ever assent to

original: de ni yid kyi nyon mongs kun //🔽ji lta bur @205b na dang du len //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi nyon mongs kun // ji lta bur @205b na dang du len //
