translated: any of the mental afflictions?

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: He has no covetousness, malice, or wrong views, respectively.

original: 'di ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po'i chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po'i chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the special quality of the Dharma that is the antidote to immorality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the quality of the purity of morality of the bodhisattvas.🔽When the compassionate one is always

original: brtse ldan gang tshe gnod pa byed pa dang // gzhan la phan pa'i sdug bsngal la rtag tu //
analyzed: brtse ldan gang tshe gnod pa byed pa dang // gzhan la phan pa'i sdug bsngal la rtag tu //
translated: suffering for the sake of others and for the sake of harming them,

original: phan pa'i 'du shes dga' ba rnyed gur pa //
analyzed: phan pa'i 'du shes dga' ba rnyed gur pa //
translated: he finds joy in the perception of benefit.

original: de yis gang la ci zhig bzod par bya //
analyzed: de yis gang la ci zhig bzod par bya //
translated: What and whom should he tolerate?

original: gnod pa byed pa la bzod pa bya dgos pa yin na /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la bzod pa bya dgos pa yin na /
translated: If it is necessary to tolerate the harm that is done,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de la phan pa'i 'du shes 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de la phan pa'i 'du shes 'thob ste /
translated: the bodhisattva obtains the perception of benefit in that,

original: bzod pa'i tshogs kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i tshogs kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the sign of the accumulation of tolerance.

original: sdug bsngal la yang bzod pa bya dgos pa yin na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la yang bzod pa bya dgos pa yin na /
translated: If it is necessary to tolerate suffering,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la phan pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de la yang rtag tu dga' ba 'thob pa na gang la gnod pa byed pa'i 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la phan pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de la yang rtag tu dga' ba 'thob pa na gang la gnod pa byed pa'i 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
translated: The bodhisattva always obtains delight in that suffering which is the cause of benefit for others. When there is no perception of an object of harm,

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ba des gang la ci zhig bzod par bya //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ba des gang la ci zhig bzod par bya //
translated: and no perception of suffering, what is there to be patient with, and in regard to what?

original: gzhan la gzhan gyi 'du shes bral ba dang // bdag pas ches lhag gzhan la rtag byams dang // dka' ba spyod phyir brtse ba dang bcas la //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan gyi 'du shes bral ba dang // bdag pas ches lhag gzhan la rtag byams dang // dka' ba spyod phyir brtse ba dang bcas la //
translated: The bodhisattva is free from the perception of other in regard to others, and is always loving toward others to a greater degree than toward himself, and is compassionate because he practices austerities.

original: brtson 'grus dka' ba min la shin tu dka' //🔽brtse ba dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dka' ba min la shin tu dka' // brtse ba dang bcas pa ni /
translated: His effort is not difficult, but is very difficult.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The compassionate one is the bodhisattva.

original: brtse ba dang bcas pa de la ni gzhan gyi don du dka' ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de dka' ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: brtse ba dang bcas pa de la ni gzhan gyi don du dka' ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de dka' ba yang ma yin la /
translated: For the compassionate one, the effort which is the practice of austerities for the sake of others is not difficult,

original: shin tu dka' ba yang yin no //
analyzed: shin tu dka' ba yang yin no //
translated: but is very difficult.

original: ji ltar dka' ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dka' ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not difficult?

original: gzhan la gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu bdag pas ches lhag par gzhan dag la byams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu bdag pas ches lhag par gzhan dag la byams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free from the notion of other in regard to others, and because he always loves others more than himself.

original: ji ltar shin tu dka' ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu dka' ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it very difficult?

original: de ltar gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba dang / bdag pas che sa lhag par byams pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba dang / bdag pas che sa lhag par byams pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de'o //
translated: It is the effort to be free from the notion of other and to love others more than oneself.

original: gsum gyi bsam gtan bde ba chung //
analyzed: gsum gyi bsam gtan bde ba chung //
translated: The mundane dhyana has little happiness,

original: bdag bde zhen pa yongs nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag bde zhen pa yongs nyams 'gyur //
translated: the disciples' and hermit buddhas' has the happiness of self,

original: zad 'gyur rmongs dang bcas par 'dod //
analyzed: zad 'gyur rmongs dang bcas par 'dod //
translated: the mundane has attachment to the perishing aggregates,🔽the disciples' and hermit buddhas' has attachment to nirvana,🔽the mundane has the fault of regression,🔽the disciples' and hermit buddhas' has the fault of cessation,🔽the mundane has the fault of delusion,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzlog pa'o //
translated: the disciples' and hermit buddhas' has the fault of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bde ba chung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bde ba chung ba'o //
translated: The mundane dhyana has little happiness.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni bdag nyid bde ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni bdag nyid bde ba'o //
translated: The disciples' and hermit buddhas' has the happiness of self.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ni 'jig tshogs @206a * //🔽la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ni 'jig tshogs @206a * // la zhen pa'o //
translated: The mundane has attachment to the perishing aggregates.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni mya ngan las 'das pa la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni mya ngan las 'das pa la zhen pa'o //
translated: The disciples' and hermit buddhas' has attachment to nirvana.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mundane person's meditation is subject to loss.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni zad par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni zad par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The Sravaka and Pratyekabuddha's meditation is subject to exhaustion,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par de zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par de zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is exhausted in the Nirvana without remainder.

original: thams cad kyi yang ci rigs par nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rmongs pas rmongs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi yang ci rigs par nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rmongs pas rmongs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: And all of them, according to their kind, are accompanied by delusion, because of their afflicted or unafflicted delusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bde ba mang ba dang / bdag dang gzhan bde ba dang ; ma zhen pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / mi zad pa dang / rmongs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bde ba mang ba dang / bdag dang gzhan bde ba dang ; ma zhen pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / mi zad pa dang / rmongs pa med pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva's meditation is of great happiness, of the happiness of self and other, of nonattachment, of nonexhaustion, of inexhaustibility, and of nondelusion.🔽The three knowledges are like the groping of a hand,

original: ji ltar mtshan mo lag nom dang // khebs sgron de bzhin shes pa gsum //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mo lag nom dang // khebs sgron de bzhin shes pa gsum //
translated: like a lamp in a dark house,🔽and like the sun.

original: snying rje can gyi shes pa ni //
analyzed: snying rje can gyi shes pa ni //
translated: The knowledge of the compassionate one

original: nyi ma'i zer bzhin mtshungs pa med //
analyzed: nyi ma'i zer bzhin mtshungs pa med //
translated: is incomparable, like the light of the sun.

original: ji ltar mun khung na lag nom dag gi shes pa yul chung ba dang / mngon sum ma yin pa dang / mi gsal ba ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mun khung na lag nom dag gi shes pa yul chung ba dang / mngon sum ma yin pa dang / mi gsal ba ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as in a dark place, the cognition of a person with defective eyes is limited, non-evident, and unclear, so it is for the worldlings.

original: ji ltar phug tu sgron mas shes pa nyi tshe ba'i mngon sum dang / shin tu dri ma med pa ma yin pa ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phug tu sgron mas shes pa nyi tshe ba'i mngon sum dang / shin tu dri ma med pa ma yin pa ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as in a cave, the cognition of a person with a lamp is limited, non-evident, and not very pure, so it is for the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis shes pa kun nas mngon sum dang / shin tu dri ma med pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis shes pa kun nas mngon sum dang / shin tu dri ma med pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as in the light of the sun, the cognition of a person is all-pervading, evident, and very pure, so it is for the Bodhisattvas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni mtshungs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni mtshungs pa med pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is incomparable.

original: sbyin pa rten dang gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: sbyin pa rten dang gzhi dang ni //
translated: Giving is considered supreme🔽in terms of basis, substance,🔽motive, dedication,

original: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
translated: cause, wisdom, field, and reliance.

original: de la rten ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de la rten ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The basis is the Bodhisattva.

original: gzhi mchog ni zang zing sbyin pa'i ni nang gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: gzhi mchog ni zang zing sbyin pa'i ni nang gi dngos po'o //
translated: The supreme basis is the internal entity of the generosity of material things.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i ni ngan song dang 'khor bas 'jigs pa dag la de dag gis mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i ni ngan song dang 'khor bas 'jigs pa dag la de dag gis mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The generosity of fearlessness is the fearlessness of those who are afraid of the miserable realms and cyclic existence.

original: chos sbyin pa'i ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa'i ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The generosity of Dharma is the Great Vehicle.

original: rgyu mtshan ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni snying rje'o //
translated: The reason is compassion.

original: yongs su bsngo ba ni gang gis 'bras bu byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba ni gang gis 'bras bu byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The dedication is that by which one seeks the result, great enlightenment.

original: rgyu ni sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: rgyu ni sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The cause is the instinct for the former practice of the perfection of generosity.

original: ye shes ni gang gis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni gang gis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa ste /
translated: The wisdom is that by which one gives gifts with the purity of the three spheres,

original: sbyin pa @206b po dang sbyin bar bya ba dang / len pa po rnams su rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa @206b po dang sbyin bar bya ba dang / len pa po rnams su rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is nonconceptual with regard to the giver, the gift, and the receiver.

original: zhing ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhing ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The field is of five types:

original: slong ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rten med pa dang / nyes par spyad pa spyod pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rten med pa dang / nyes par spyad pa spyod pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: beggars, the miserable, the helpless, those who engage in negative conduct, and those who have good qualities.

original: gzhi ni phyi ma phyi ma zhing dam pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi ni phyi ma phyi ma zhing dam pa yin no //
translated: The basis is the latter, which is superior.

original: de dag med na lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de dag med na lnga pa'o //
translated: If they do not exist, it is the fifth.

original: gang la gnas nas sbyin pa'i gnas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gang la gnas nas sbyin pa'i gnas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The basis of giving is threefold:

original: mos pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: mos pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: interest, attention, and concentration.

original: mos pa ni /
analyzed: mos pa ni /
translated: Interest is

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as described in the Analysis of the Application of Almsgiving:🔽“What is interest?🔽It is the desire to give.🔽Attention is

original: sgom pa rnam par dbye ba las mos pa yid la byed pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgom pa rnam par dbye ba las mos pa yid la byed pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: as described in the same text:

original: yid la byed pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni ji skad du /
translated: “What is attention?

original: de nyid las ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid las ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the attention of relishing, rejoicing, and delighting.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa ste /
translated: Concentration is the sky-treasury concentration, etc.

original: ji skad du de nyid las dbang 'byor ba bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du de nyid las dbang 'byor ba bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is as described in the same text:🔽“What is concentration?🔽It is the mastery of mind.

original: de ltar na rten la sogs pa mchog gis sbyin pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rten la sogs pa mchog gis sbyin pa mchog yin no //
translated: Thus, giving is superior through the superiority of the basis, etc.

original: 'dir ni gang zhes bstan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni gang zhes bstan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the word “etc.” should be understood as referring to the following:

original: gang dang / gang zhig dang / gang gis dang / gang gi phyir dang / gang las dang / gang gis yongs su zin pa dang / gang la dang rnam pa ji snyed sbyin pa de ni sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang / gang zhig dang / gang gis dang / gang gi phyir dang / gang las dang / gang gis yongs su zin pa dang / gang la dang rnam pa ji snyed sbyin pa de ni sbyin pa yin no //
translated: What is given, to whom, by what means, for what purpose, from what source, by whom possessed, to whom, in what manner, to that extent is it generosity.

original: tshul khrims rten dang gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims rten dang gzhi dang ni //
translated: Morality is considered supreme🔽in terms of basis, substance,🔽cause, intuition, field,

original: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
translated: and reliance.

original: bzod pa rten dang gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: bzod pa rten dang gzhi dang ni //
translated: Patience is considered supreme🔽in terms of basis, substance,🔽cause, intuition, field,

original: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
translated: and reliance.🔽Effort is considered supreme

original: brtson 'grus rten dang gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rten dang gzhi dang ni //
translated: in terms of basis, substance,🔽cause, intuition, field,

original: rgyu mtshan da nga ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan da nga ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
translated: and reliance.🔽Meditation is considered supreme

original: bsam gtan rten dang gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan rten dang gzhi dang ni //
translated: in terms of basis, substance,🔽cause, intuition, field,🔽and reliance.

original: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //
translated: The best is held to be in terms of cause,

original: shes rab rten dang gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: shes rab rten dang gzhi dang ni //
translated: wisdom, field, and reliance.🔽The best of wisdom is held to be in terms of

original: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod //🔽tshul khrims kyi gzhi mchog ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rgyu dang ye shes zhing dag dang // gnas kyi sgo nas mchog tu 'dod // tshul khrims kyi gzhi mchog ni /
translated: cause, wisdom, field, and reliance.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: The best basis of morality is the vow of the bodhisattva.

original: bzod pa'i ni ngan pa stobs chung ngus gsod pa dag go //🔽brtson 'grus kyi ni pha rol tu @207a * //
analyzed: bzod pa'i ni ngan pa stobs chung ngus gsod pa dag go // brtson 'grus kyi ni pha rol tu @207a * //
translated: The best basis of patience is the killing of weak and lowly people.

original: phyin bsgom pa dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'o //
analyzed: phyin bsgom pa dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'o //
translated: The best basis of effort is the cultivation of the transcendences and the abandonment of their resistances.

original: bsam gtan gyi ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: The best basis of meditation is the bodhisattva’s meditative concentrations.

original: shes rab kyi ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The best basis of wisdom is suchness.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa thams cad kyi zhing ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa thams cad kyi zhing ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The best field of all the transcendences, morality, etc., is the Great Vehicle.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as before.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni //🔽sems can gcig bde bskal mang du //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni // sems can gcig bde bskal mang du //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattvas🔽brings happiness to a single being,

original: gnod pa byed kyang dga' 'gyur na //
analyzed: gnod pa byed kyang dga' 'gyur na //
translated: but they are joyful even when they are harmed for many eons.

original: de las bzlog pa smos ci dgos //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa smos ci dgos //
translated: What need to mention what is the opposite of that?

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa ni sems can gcig kho na bde bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa ni sems can gcig kho na bde bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even if the generosity of the bodhisattvas brings happiness to only a single being,

original: bdag la ni bskal pa mang por gnod pa byed du zin kyang /
analyzed: bdag la ni bskal pa mang por gnod pa byed du zin kyang /
translated: and even if it harms them for many eons,

original: 'on kyang snying rje'i khyad par gyis de dag de la dga' bar 'gyur na /🔽sems can yang du ma zhig la bde bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang snying rje'i khyad par gyis de dag de la dga' bar 'gyur na / sems can yang du ma zhig la bde bar 'gyur la /
translated: nevertheless, because of the power of compassion, they are joyful.🔽What need is there to mention that they bring happiness to many beings

original: bdag nyid la yang bskal pa mang por phan pa byed pa gang yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang bskal pa mang por phan pa byed pa gang yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: and benefit themselves for many eons?

original: lus can rnams ni gang phyir nor 'dod pa //
analyzed: lus can rnams ni gang phyir nor 'dod pa //
translated: Because embodied beings desire wealth,

original: brtan rnams de nyid lus can rnams la gtong //
analyzed: brtan rnams de nyid lus can rnams la gtong //
translated: the steadfast give it to embodied beings.

original: skye bo rnams ni lus phyir nor 'dod de //
analyzed: skye bo rnams ni lus phyir nor 'dod de //
translated: Because people desire a body for the sake of wealth,

original: de nyid brtan rnams brgya phrag rnams su gtong //
analyzed: de nyid brtan rnams brgya phrag rnams su gtong //
translated: the steadfast give away hundreds of their bodies.

original: de la phyed snga ma phyed phyi mas bshad do //
analyzed: de la phyed snga ma phyed phyi mas bshad do //
translated: The second half is explained by the first half.

original: gang tshe lus nyid gtong yang yid sdug mi bsngal ba //
analyzed: gang tshe lus nyid gtong yang yid sdug mi bsngal ba //
translated: When one gives away even one’s body and is not pained in mind,

original: de tshe rdzas ngan lta la smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: de tshe rdzas ngan lta la smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
translated: what need to mention external things of little value?

original: de 'di'i 'jig rten 'das pa de des dga' 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de 'di'i 'jig rten 'das pa de des dga' 'gyur ba //
translated: This is his transcendence of the world, and that is his joy.

original: gang yin de ni de yi yang ni bla ma yin //
analyzed: gang yin de ni de yi yang ni bla ma yin //
translated: That is his superiority, and that is his excellence.

original: 'di la gang gi tshe lus nyid gtong ba na yid sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ba de ni 'di'i 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la gang gi tshe lus nyid gtong ba na yid sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ba de ni 'di'i 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Here it is shown that when one gives away even one’s body, if one is not pained in mind, that is his transcendence of the world.

original: de sdug bsngal des bde bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i yang bla ma yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa de bas kyang bla ma yin no //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal des bde bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i yang bla ma yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa de bas kyang bla ma yin no //
translated: That is his joy in that suffering. That is his superiority, and that is his excellence. That is his transcendence of the world, and that is his excellence.

original: ji ltar blo ldan 'di na kun gtong bas //
analyzed: ji ltar blo ldan 'di na kun gtong bas //
translated: Just as the genius, giving everything,

original: don gnyer skye bo dga' bas dga' ba ltar //🔽de ltar slong mo pa dag blang bya ba //
analyzed: don gnyer skye bo dga' bas dga' ba ltar // de ltar slong mo pa dag blang bya ba //
translated: rejoices in the joy of the supplicant,🔽so the supplicant, receiving everything he wished for,

original: 'dod dgu thob pa dag gis dga' mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod dgu thob pa dag gis dga' mi 'gyur //
translated: would not be so delighted.

original: kun gtong ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi srog man chad gtong bas so /
analyzed: kun gtong ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi srog man chad gtong bas so /
translated: The giver of all is one who gives even his own life.

original: 'dod dgu thob pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni ci 'dod pa thob pa dag gis so //🔽blo can bdog dgu btang bas nor med pa //
analyzed: 'dod dgu thob pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni ci 'dod pa thob pa dag gis so // blo can bdog dgu btang bas nor med pa //
translated: The one who obtains all that he desires is one who obtains whatever he wishes.🔽The wise man, by giving away all his possessions,

original: bdag nyid nor ldan sems pa ji lta bar //
analyzed: bdag nyid nor ldan sems pa ji lta bar //
translated: is not considered poor,

original: slong ba longs spyod kun rdzogs bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: slong ba longs spyod kun rdzogs bdag nyid ni //
translated: but the beggar, who is replete with all enjoyments,

original: @207b de ltar nor dang ldan par mi sems so //
analyzed: @207b de ltar nor dang ldan par mi sems so //
translated: is not considered rich.

original: ji ltar blo ldan 'di ni sbyin pa bzang pos tshul bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar blo ldan 'di ni sbyin pa bzang pos tshul bzhin du //
translated: Just as the wise man, by his excellent generosity,

original: don gnyer tshim byas de la phan chen 'dogs par sems pa ltar /
analyzed: don gnyer tshim byas de la phan chen 'dogs par sems pa ltar /
translated: satisfies the needs of petitioners and thinks of them as greatly helpful to himself,

original: de bzhin slong mo ba dag shin tu nor mang thob nas ni //
analyzed: de bzhin slong mo ba dag shin tu nor mang thob nas ni //
translated: in the same way, when beggars obtain a great deal from him,

original: sbyin pa po la rnyed pa'i rgyu yis drin du mi rtsi'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa po la rnyed pa'i rgyu yis drin du mi rtsi'o //
translated: they do not consider him grateful for the favor of being given the opportunity to make a gift.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don ni go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the two verses is self-evident.

original: lam ka'i 'bras mchog ldan pa'i shing las longs spyod ji lta bar //
analyzed: lam ka'i 'bras mchog ldan pa'i shing las longs spyod ji lta bar //
translated: Just as one may enjoy the excellent fruit of a tree on the roadside,

original: lus can rnams kyis gang gi nor rdzas rgya cher blangs nas ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyis gang gi nor rdzas rgya cher blangs nas ni //
translated: When embodied beings take up his vast wealth

original: bdag nyid dogs dang bral bar rang nyams spyod par byed pa la //
analyzed: bdag nyid dogs dang bral bar rang nyams spyod par byed pa la //
translated: and enjoy it themselves without fear,

original: btang dga' longs spyod can de byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan min //
analyzed: btang dga' longs spyod can de byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan min //
translated: that one who delights in giving and enjoying is not other than a bodhisattva.

original: 'di la btang pa la dga' ba'i longs spyod yod pas na btang dga' longs spyod can te /
analyzed: 'di la btang pa la dga' ba'i longs spyod yod pas na btang dga' longs spyod can te /
translated: Here, one who delights in giving and enjoys is one who delights in giving and has wealth.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That one should be known as not other than a bodhisattva.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //🔽gtso dang 'di rgyu las kyi dbye ba dang // rnam pa'i dbye ba rten gyi dbye ba dang // bar chad rnam bzhi'i gnyen po'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do // gtso dang 'di rgyu las kyi dbye ba dang // rnam pa'i dbye ba rten gyi dbye ba dang // bar chad rnam bzhi'i gnyen po'i dbye ba yis //
translated: The rest is easily understood.🔽Diligence should be understood in terms of🔽its preeminence, its cause, its types of activity,🔽its varieties, its basis, and its antidotes to the four obstructions.

original: brtson 'grus yongs shes bya zhes rab tu bstan //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs shes bya zhes rab tu bstan //
translated: It is taught that diligence should be understood in terms of its preeminence, its cause, its types of activity, its varieties, its basis, and its antidotes to the four obstructions.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug po gtso bo'i dbye ba dang / de'i rgyu'i dbye ba dang / las kyi dbye ba dang / rnam pa'i dbye ba dang / rten gyi dbye ba dang / bar chad rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i dbye bas brtson 'grus yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug po gtso bo'i dbye ba dang / de'i rgyu'i dbye ba dang / las kyi dbye ba dang / rnam pa'i dbye ba dang / rten gyi dbye ba dang / bar chad rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i dbye bas brtson 'grus yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand striving through its six divisions: division of the chief, division of its cause, division of its activity, division of its aspects, division of its basis, and division of its antidote to the four obstructions.

original: bstan pa 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa phyi ma rnams kyis bshad do //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa phyi ma rnams kyis bshad do //
translated: This teaching is explained in the following verses.

original: dge ba'i tshogs kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog //
analyzed: dge ba'i tshogs kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog //
translated: Striving is the best of all virtuous practices,

original: 'di ltar de la brten nas de rjes 'thob //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la brten nas de rjes 'thob //
translated: because all virtuous practices follow from it.🔽Through striving one quickly attains the highest happiness in this life,

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni mod la bde gnas mchog / dngos grub 'jig rten 'das dang 'jig rten gtogs //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni mod la bde gnas mchog / dngos grub 'jig rten 'das dang 'jig rten gtogs //
translated: and also the mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: dge ba'i tshogs kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog / ces bya ba ni brtson 'grus dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gtso bo yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba'i tshogs kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog / ces bya ba ni brtson 'grus dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gtso bo yin par bstan to //
translated: Striving is the best of all virtuous practices. This shows that striving is the chief of all virtuous practices.

original: 'di ltar de la brten nas de rjes 'thob //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la brten nas de rjes 'thob //
translated: Because all virtuous practices follow from it.

original: ces bya ba ni gtso bo'i rgyu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gtso bo'i rgyu bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the principal cause.

original: 'di ltar brtson 'grus la brten nas dge ba'i chos thams cad 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar brtson 'grus la brten nas dge ba'i chos thams cad 'thob bo //
translated: Thus, on the basis of effort, one attains all virtuous qualities.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni mod la bde gnas mchog / dngos grub 'jig rten 'das dang 'jig rten gtogs //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni mod la bde gnas mchog / dngos grub 'jig rten 'das dang 'jig rten gtogs //
translated: Through effort, one quickly attains the highest happiness in this life, and the mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: zhes bya ba ni las bstan pa ste /🔽brtson 'grus @208a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las bstan pa ste / brtson 'grus @208a * //
translated: This shows the action.🔽Through effort, one attains the highest happiness in this very life.

original: kyis ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa thams cad kyang 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: kyis ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa thams cad kyang 'grub par byed do //
translated: And through effort, one accomplishes all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni srid gcod 'dod pa 'thob //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni srid gcod 'dod pa 'thob //
translated: Through effort, one obtains the desired existence.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni dag pa rab 'gyur ldan //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni dag pa rab 'gyur ldan //
translated: Through effort, one becomes endowed with pure, abundant qualities.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig tshogs 'das nas grol //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig tshogs 'das nas grol //
translated: Through effort, one transcends the perishing aggregates and is liberated.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni byang chub mchog sangs rgyas //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni byang chub mchog sangs rgyas //
translated: Through effort, one attains supreme enlightenment and buddhahood.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi bye brag gi sgo nas rnam grangs gzhan gyis brtson 'grus kyi las kho na bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi bye brag gi sgo nas rnam grangs gzhan gyis brtson 'grus kyi las kho na bstan te /
translated: The same topic, the subject of effort, is taught by another enumeration, from the point of view of the distinctions between mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: de la rab tu 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rab tu 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mundane perfections are not permanent, because they are subject to regression.🔽Moreover, effort is considered to be of six kinds:

original: gzhan yang nyams dang 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus dang // thar pa'i dbang dang mi mthun phyogs spangs gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyams dang 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus dang // thar pa'i dbang dang mi mthun phyogs spangs gzhan //
translated: effort in nonforgetting, in guarding, in not being discouraged, in not being elated, in not being attached, and in not being lax.🔽The bodhisattva who is endowed with these six kinds of effort is said to be always and everywhere making effort.🔽The effort of armor is at the beginning, then the effort of application,

original: de nyid rab zhugs yongs su sgrub byed dang ; / brtson 'grus don chen nges tshig gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid rab zhugs yongs su sgrub byed dang ; / brtson 'grus don chen nges tshig gzhan du 'dod //
translated: which is well engaged in the correct procedures.🔽Effort is said to be of six kinds:🔽effort in nonforgetting, in guarding, in not being discouraged, in not being elated, in not being attached, and in not being lax.🔽The bodhisattva who is endowed with these six kinds of effort is said to be always and everywhere making effort.

original: thog mar go cha'i brtson 'grus de nas ni //
analyzed: thog mar go cha'i brtson 'grus de nas ni //
translated: The effort of armor is at the beginning, then the effort of application,🔽which is well engaged in the correct procedures.🔽Effort is said to be of six kinds:🔽effort in nonforgetting, in guarding, in not being discouraged, in not being elated, in not being attached, and in not being lax.🔽The bodhisattva who is endowed with these six kinds of effort is said to be always and everywhere making effort.🔽The effort of armor is at the beginning, then the effort of application,

original: tshul bzhin rab zhugs sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus te //
analyzed: tshul bzhin rab zhugs sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus te //
translated: which is well engaged in the correct procedures.🔽Effort is said to be of six kinds:

original: ma zhum mi 'khrugs chog mi shes brtson 'grus //
analyzed: ma zhum mi 'khrugs chog mi shes brtson 'grus //
translated: effort in nonforgetting, in guarding, in not being discouraged, in not being elated, in not being attached, and in not being lax.

original: rnam pa thams cad sangs rgyas rnams rab gsungs //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad sangs rgyas rnams rab gsungs //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with these six kinds of effort is said to be always and everywhere making effort.🔽The effort of armor is at the beginning, then the effort of application,🔽which is well engaged in the correct procedures.

original: 'di ni rnam pa'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa'i dbye ba ste /
translated: Effort is said to be of six kinds:🔽effort in nonforgetting, in guarding, in not being discouraged, in not being elated, in not being attached, and in not being lax.🔽The bodhisattva who is endowed with these six kinds of effort is said to be always and everywhere making effort.

original: de la nyams pa dang / 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus ni yang dag par spong ba rnams la ste /
analyzed: de la nyams pa dang / 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus ni yang dag par spong ba rnams la ste /
translated: Effort of decrease and increase is in the four right efforts.

original: gnyis la mi dge ba'i chos nyams par byed pa dang / gnyis la dge ba'i chos 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis la mi dge ba'i chos nyams par byed pa dang / gnyis la dge ba'i chos 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In two, it decreases nonvirtuous dharmas; in two, it increases virtuous dharmas.

original: thar pa'i dbang gi brtson 'grus ni dbang po rnams la ste //
analyzed: thar pa'i dbang gi brtson 'grus ni dbang po rnams la ste //
translated: Effort of control of liberation is in the five faculties.

original: 'di ltar thar pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis dbang po rnams yin pas so //🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar thar pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis dbang po rnams yin pas so // mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the faculties are so called because they control liberation.

original: stobs rnams la ste /
analyzed: stobs rnams la ste /
translated: Effort of abandoning the discordant class is in the five powers.

original: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi ba'i don gyis stobs rnams yin pas so //🔽de kho na nyid la rab tu zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi ba'i don gyis stobs rnams yin pas so // de kho na nyid la rab tu zhugs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the powers are so called because they crush the discordant class.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la ste /
translated: Effort of entering reality is in the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: mthong ba'i lam la de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //🔽de yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro // de yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni /
translated: They are so called because they are established on the path of seeing.

original: lam gyi yan lag rnams la ste /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnams la ste /
translated: Effort of transforming it is in the eightfold path.🔽Thus, the path is so called because it transforms one into a noble being.

original: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam la @208b gnas yongs su 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽don chen po'i brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam la @208b gnas yongs su 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // don chen po'i brtson 'grus ni /
translated: This is because it is the cause of the transmutation of the life-stream in the path of meditative development.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The effort of great import is the essence of the perfections,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accomplishes the benefit of self and other.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus ni sbyor ba'i phyir go bgos pa yin no //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus ni sbyor ba'i phyir go bgos pa yin no //
translated: The armour-effort is the donning of the armour of application.

original: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ni /
translated: The application-effort is

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the application in that way.

original: ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
translated: The undaunted effort is

original: rtogs par bya ba rgya chen po la yang zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba rgya chen po la yang zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the absence of dispiritedness even in regard to the vast to be understood.

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
translated: The unshakeable effort is

original: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the unshakeability by suffering such as cold and heat.

original: chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
translated: The insatiable effort is

original: rtogs pa cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the non-acceptance of satisfaction with just a little understanding.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa 'di dag nyid /
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa 'di dag nyid /
translated: These very armour-efforts etc.

original: mdo las / mthu dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spri ba can dang // pha rol gnon pa brtan pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson pa ma btang ba zhes 'byung ba dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo las / mthu dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spri ba can dang // pha rol gnon pa brtan pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson pa ma btang ba zhes 'byung ba dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The sutra says, “Endowed with power, endowed with effort, endowed with mindfulness, endowed with tranquility and insight, endowed with firmness in overcoming the enemies, and not abandoning the effort for the wholesome dharmas. ”

original: theg pa gsum brtson skye bo la brten nas //
analyzed: theg pa gsum brtson skye bo la brten nas //
translated: The effort of those who are devoted to the three vehicles is inferior, middling, and superior,

original: bsam blo zhan dang rgya rab che ldan phyir //🔽brtson 'grus tha ma 'bring dang mchog gzhan te //
analyzed: bsam blo zhan dang rgya rab che ldan phyir // brtson 'grus tha ma 'bring dang mchog gzhan te //
translated: respectively, because of the smallness and vastness of their thoughts.

original: de ni don chung ba dang don chen 'dod //
analyzed: de ni don chung ba dang don chen 'dod //
translated: The inferior, middling, and superior efforts are considered to be of small account and of great account.

original: 'dis ni rten gyi bye brag gis brtson 'grus kyi dbye ba bstan te //
analyzed: 'dis ni rten gyi bye brag gis brtson 'grus kyi dbye ba bstan te //
translated: This shows the classification of effort according to the differences in the persons who practice it.

original: theg pa gsum la rab tu brtson pa'i skye bo gang yin pa de la brten nas go rims bzhin du brtson 'grus tha ma dang // 'bring dang mchog tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la rab tu brtson pa'i skye bo gang yin pa de la brten nas go rims bzhin du brtson 'grus tha ma dang // 'bring dang mchog tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The effort of those who are devoted to the three vehicles is to be known as inferior, middling, and superior, respectively.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is this?

original: bsam pa dang blo zhan pa dang / rgya rab tu chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang blo zhan pa dang / rgya rab tu chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their thoughts and their understanding are small and vast.

original: bsam ba dang blo zhan pa ni theg pa gnyis la rab tu brtson pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: bsam ba dang blo zhan pa ni theg pa gnyis la rab tu brtson pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The weak and inferior is that of those who are intent on the two vehicles.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gi yus su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gi yus su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is only for the sake of oneself.

original: rgya rab tu chen po ni theg pa chen po la rab tu brtson pa rnams kyi ste //
analyzed: rgya rab tu chen po ni theg pa chen po la rab tu brtson pa rnams kyi ste //
translated: The vast is that of those who are intent on the Great Vehicle.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is for the sake of oneself and others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus de ni go rims bzhin du don chung ba dang // don chen por 'dod @209a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus de ni go rims bzhin du don chung ba dang // don chen por 'dod @209a * //
translated: Therefore, that effort is considered to be of small benefit and of great benefit, respectively.

original: de ; rang gi don gyi yus su byed pa'i phyir dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ; rang gi don gyi yus su byed pa'i phyir dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is only for the sake of oneself and because it is for the sake of oneself and others.

original: brtson 'grus ldan pa longs spyod kyis pham med //🔽brtson 'grus ldan pa nyon mongs kyis pham med //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan pa longs spyod kyis pham med // brtson 'grus ldan pa nyon mongs kyis pham med //
translated: The energetic are not defeated by wealth.🔽The energetic are not defeated by the defilements.

original: brtson 'grus ldan pa skyo bas pham pa med //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan pa skyo bas pham pa med //
translated: The energetic are not defeated by weariness.

original: brtson 'grus ldan pa thob pas pham pa med //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan pa thob pas pham pa med //
translated: The energetic are not defeated by attainment.

original: ces bya ba 'di ni bar du gcod pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i dbye ba ste //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di ni bar du gcod pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i dbye ba ste //
translated: This is the analysis of the antidotes to the four obstacles.

original: gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste //
analyzed: gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste //
translated: There are four obstacles to generosity, etc. that prevent one from engaging in generosity, etc.

original: longs spyod la chags pa ni de kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa ni de kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment to resources, because one holds on to them.

original: nyon mongs pa ni de yongs su gcod pa la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni de yongs su gcod pa la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Afflictions, because one is attached to the elimination of them.

original: skyo ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor bar brtson pa la yongs su skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor bar brtson pa la yongs su skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Discouragement, because one is weary of striving to practice generosity, etc.

original: thob pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Satisfaction, because one is satisfied with only a little generosity, etc.

original: de dag gi gnyen po'i bye brag gis brtson 'grus rnam pa 'di bzhi bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po'i bye brag gis brtson 'grus rnam pa 'di bzhi bshad do //
translated: The four kinds of effort are explained as the specific antidotes to those four.

original: phan tshun rnam par nges pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par nges pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: A verse on the analysis of their mutual determination

original: phan tshun bsdus phyir rab dbye'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun bsdus phyir rab dbye'i phyir //
translated: They are mutually inclusive, and also mutually exclusive.

original: chos nyid phyir dang rgyu mtshan phyir //🔽pha rol phyin drug rnam kun tu //
analyzed: chos nyid phyir dang rgyu mtshan phyir // pha rol phyin drug rnam kun tu //
translated: Because of reality and because of reason,🔽one should know the six perfections

original: rnam par nges par shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam par nges par shes par bya //
translated: in all their forms as definitely included in each other.

original: phan tshun bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par nges pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa bsdus te /
analyzed: phan tshun bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par nges pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa bsdus te /
translated: The definite inclusion of one in another is as follows: Generosity is included in morality and patience,

original: 'di ltar de gnyis kyis mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis kyis mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: because those two give fearlessly.

original: chos kyi sbyin pas ni bsam gtan dang shes rab dag ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pas ni bsam gtan dang shes rab dag ste /
translated: Concentration and wisdom are included in the giving of Dharma,

original: 'di ltar de gnyis kyi sa chos sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis kyi sa chos sbyin par byed do //
translated: because those two give the Dharma.

original: gnyi gas ni brtson 'grus te 'di ltar des gnyis ka sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: gnyi gas ni brtson 'grus te 'di ltar des gnyis ka sbyin par byed do //
translated: All are included in effort, because it gives all.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus te /
translated: Morality that gathers virtuous factors includes all the perfections, generosity and so on.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus pa yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus pa yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, all should be applied as appropriate to the inclusion of all in patience and so on.

original: rab tu dbye bas rnam par nges pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas rnam par nges pa ni /
translated: The definite discernment of their classification is as follows.

original: gzhan @209b gyi rgyud la tshul khrims la sogs pa 'jog pa'i phyir sbyin pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gzhan @209b gyi rgyud la tshul khrims la sogs pa 'jog pa'i phyir sbyin pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Generosity is sixfold because it establishes morality, etc. in the lifestreams of others.

original: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i par yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i par yin no //
translated: It is the generosity of generosity, the generosity of morality, up to the generosity of wisdom.🔽Ascertainment by nature refers to the fact that the meaning of generosity, etc. is evident in the sutras, etc.

original: chos nyid kyis rnam par nges pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don gang dag la mdo la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa dang // mdo la sogs pa'i chos gang dag la /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis rnam par nges pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don gang dag la mdo la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa dang // mdo la sogs pa'i chos gang dag la /
translated: and the meaning of the sutras, etc. is evident in generosity, etc.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these are mutually inclusive.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi phyir rnam par nges pa ni sbyin pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi phyir rnam par nges pa ni sbyin pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te //
translated: Ascertainment by reason refers to the fact that generosity, etc. is the reason for generosity, etc.

original: longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one does not look at wealth, one engages in morality, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: Morality is also the reason for generosity, etc.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs na yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad gtong ba'i phyir dang // tshul khrims la gnas na bzod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs na yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad gtong ba'i phyir dang // tshul khrims la gnas na bzod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni /
translated: If one has taken up the vow of a monk, one gives up all possessions and one is endowed with patience and so on, if one is established in morality.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: The morality of gathering virtuous factors is the cause of all generosity and so on.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa la sogs pa phan tshun gyi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin pa yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa la sogs pa phan tshun gyi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yin pa yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should apply the other virtues, such as patience, to the other perfections, as appropriate.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun ste /
translated: Seven verses on the analysis of the means of gathering disciples

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni /
translated: The four means of gathering disciples are

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba nyid dang / don spyod pa nyid dang // don mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba nyid dang / don spyod pa nyid dang // don mthun pa nyid do //
translated: generosity, agreeable speech, beneficent conduct, and sameness of purpose.🔽Among them,🔽Generosity, teaching, encouraging, and likewise exemplifying

original: de la ; sbyin mtshungs de ston len 'jug dang // bdag nyid rjes su 'jug rnams kyis //
analyzed: de la ; sbyin mtshungs de ston len 'jug dang // bdag nyid rjes su 'jug rnams kyis //
translated: are the means of gathering disciples.

original: snyan par smra dang don spyod dang // don mthun nyid du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: snyan par smra dang don spyod dang // don mthun nyid du 'dod pa yin //
translated: and sameness of purpose are accepted as the four means of attraction.

original: sbyin pa ni mtshungs par 'dod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni mtshungs par 'dod de /
translated: Generosity is accepted as the means of attraction that consists of giving material aid.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi skabs nas ji skad du bshad pa lta bu yin no //🔽snyan par smra ba ni de ston pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi skabs nas ji skad du bshad pa lta bu yin no // snyan par smra ba ni de ston pa yin no //
translated: It is just as it is explained in the context of the perfections.

original: don spyod pa ni /🔽de yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni / de yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is the means of attraction that consists of giving instruction.🔽Helpful activity is the means of attraction that consists of engaging others in the practice of what has been taught.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bzung @210a * //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bzung @210a * //
translated: The word “that” refers to the perfections.

original: ste ; pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ste ; pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one teaches the perfections and engages others in the practice of the perfections.

original: don mthun pa nyid ni gang la gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa de la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa nyid ni gang la gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa de la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Sameness of purpose is the means of attraction that consists of engaging in the practice that one has recommended to others.

original: yang ci'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir 'dod ce na /🔽'di ni gzhan dag la //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir 'dod ce na / 'di ni gzhan dag la //
translated: Why are the four means of attraction considered to be means of attraction?🔽They are means of attraction🔽because they attract others

original: phan par byed pa'i thabs dang ni //
analyzed: phan par byed pa'i thabs dang ni //
translated: and because they benefit others.

original: 'dzin par byed dang 'jug byed dang // de bzhin rjes su 'jug byed pa //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed dang 'jug byed dang // de bzhin rjes su 'jug byed pa //
translated: The one who apprehends, the one who engages, and likewise the one who follows,🔽

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir shes bya //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir shes bya //
translated: The four social practices are to be known as the means of gathering disciples.

original: sbyin pa ni phan par byed pa'i thabs te //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni phan par byed pa'i thabs te //
translated: Generosity is the means of benefiting others.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pas lus la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pas lus la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the gift of material things, one benefits their bodies.

original: snyan par smra ba ni 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: Agreeable speech is the means of holding disciples.

original: bye brag tu mi shes pa dang // the tshom za bar don 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu mi shes pa dang // the tshom za bar don 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By it, one causes those who do not understand the meaning or who doubt to take up the meaning.

original: don spyod pa ni 'jug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: don spyod pa ni 'jug par byed pa ste /
translated: Steadfastness is the means of engaging disciples.

original: dge ba la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By it, one causes them to engage in virtue.

original: don mthun pa ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa ste /
translated: Common aim is the means of completing the engagement.

original: yang dag par len du 'jug par byed pa po ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rig nas des dge ba gang la gzhan dag bcug pa de la rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par len du 'jug par byed pa po ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rig nas des dge ba gang la gzhan dag bcug pa de la rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: One who is engaged in the same aim as others is known to be one who does what he teaches.

original: dang pos snod 'gyur dngos po ste //
analyzed: dang pos snod 'gyur dngos po ste //
translated: The first is the means of making a vessel;

original: gnyis pa yis ni mos pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa yis ni mos pa yin //
translated: the second, the means of arousing faith;

original: gsum pa yis ni sgrub pa ste //
analyzed: gsum pa yis ni sgrub pa ste //
translated: The third is for the practice of the Dharma.

original: bzhi pas rnam par par sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pas rnam par par sbyong ba'o //
translated: The fourth is for the purification of that practice.

original: zang zing gi sbyin bas ni snod du rung bar 'gyur ta /
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin bas ni snod du rung bar 'gyur ta /
translated: By the gift of material goods, one becomes a suitable vessel,

original: chos nyan du btub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyan du btub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is able to listen to the Dharma.

original: snyan par smra bas ni chos de la mos par byed de //
analyzed: snyan par smra bas ni chos de la mos par byed de //
translated: By agreeable speech, one is inspired with faith in that Dharma,

original: de'i don bye brag tu shes par byed pa dang // the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don bye brag tu shes par byed pa dang // the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one understands its meaning in detail and one's doubts are resolved.

original: don spyod pas ni chos bzhin du sgrub bar byed do //
analyzed: don spyod pas ni chos bzhin du sgrub bar byed do //
translated: By the performance of beneficial actions, one practices in accordance with the Dharma.

original: don mthun pas yun ring por sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa de rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: don mthun pas yun ring por sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa de rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: By the bestowal of equality, that practice is purified, because it is practiced for a long time.

original: 'di ni bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyi las yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyi las yin no //
translated: This is the function of the means of gathering.

original: zang zing dang ni chos kyis te //
analyzed: zang zing dang ni chos kyis te //
translated: By material goods and by the Dharma,

original: dmigs pa'i chos la sogs pa yis //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos la sogs pa yis //
translated: by the Dharma of meditative concentration, etc.,

original: bsdu ba gnyis kyi sgo nas ni //
analyzed: bsdu ba gnyis kyi sgo nas ni //
translated: by the two means of gathering,

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir 'dod do //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir 'dod do //
translated: the four means of gathering are accepted.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zang zing gis bsdu ba dang / chos kyis bsdu ba dang / bsdu ba gzhan gnyis gsungs pa de dag gis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di dag kho na bsdus te //
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zang zing gis bsdu ba dang / chos kyis bsdu ba dang / bsdu ba gzhan gnyis gsungs pa de dag gis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di dag kho na bsdus te //
translated: The Blessed One has taught two other ways of gathering: gathering through material things and gathering through the Dharma.

original: dang po ni zang zing gis bsdu bas so //
analyzed: dang po ni zang zing gis bsdu bas so //
translated: The first is through gathering through material things.

original: lhag ma rnams ni @210b chos kyis bsdu bas so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni @210b chos kyis bsdu bas so //
translated: The others are through gathering through the Dharma.

original: de dag kyang chos rnam pa gsum po dmigs pa'i chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang de rnam par sbyong ba'i chos dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos rnam pa gsum po dmigs pa'i chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang de rnam par sbyong ba'i chos dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: And these are the three kinds of Dharma: the Dharma that is the object, the Dharma that is practice, and the Dharma that is purification, respectively.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba'i sgo nas ni //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba'i sgo nas ni //
translated: In terms of their categories,🔽one should know that gathering is inferior, middling, or superior,

original: bsdu ba dman dang 'bring dang mchog / phal cher don med don yod dang // rnam kun don yod shes par bya /
analyzed: bsdu ba dman dang 'bring dang mchog / phal cher don med don yod dang // rnam kun don yod shes par bya /
translated: mostly fruitless, mostly fruitful,🔽and completely fruitful.

original: 'di ni bsdu ba'i rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdu ba'i rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the analysis of the categories of gathering.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsdu ba dman pa dang / 'bring dang / mchog ni theg pa gsum la rab tu zhugs pa dag la rig par bya ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsdu ba dman pa dang / 'bring dang / mchog ni theg pa gsum la rab tu zhugs pa dag la rig par bya ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: The inferior, middling, and superior social practices of the bodhisattvas should be understood in relation to those who are engaged in the three vehicles, respectively.

original: phal cher don med ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: phal cher don med ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattva is not without effect, for the most part, on the stage of action out of faith.

original: phal cher don yod pa ni sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: phal cher don yod pa ni sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is not without effect on those who have entered the stages.

original: rnam pa thams cad du don yod pa ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du don yod pa ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ste /
translated: It is completely without effect on the eighth stage, etc.

original: sems can gyi don gdon mi za bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gdon mi za bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: , because the welfare of sentient beings is accomplished without effort.

original: 'khor sdud pa dang ldan pa rnams //
analyzed: 'khor sdud pa dang ldan pa rnams //
translated: Those who are engaged in gathering a retinue

original: tshul 'di la ni yang dag brten //
analyzed: tshul 'di la ni yang dag brten //
translated: should rely on this method.

original: kun gyi don kun sgrub byed cing //
analyzed: kun gyi don kun sgrub byed cing //
translated: It accomplishes all the aims of all,

original: thabs bzang yin par rab tu bsngags //🔽su dga' khor sdud pa la zhugs pa de dag thams cad kyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thabs bzang yin par rab tu bsngags // su dga' khor sdud pa la zhugs pa de dag thams cad kyis ni 'di lta ste /

original: bsdu ba'i dngos bo bzhi'i thabs kho na la yang dag par brten te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos bo bzhi'i thabs kho na la yang dag par brten te /
translated: Those who are engaged in gathering a retinue should rely on just this method, namely, the four social practices.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni thams cad kyi don kun 'grub par byed pa dang / thabs bzang po yin par sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni thams cad kyi don kun 'grub par byed pa dang / thabs bzang po yin par sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so //
translated: Thus, this is the means for accomplishing all goals of all, and it is highly praised by the buddhas as the excellent method.

original: bsdus dang sdud par 'gyur ba dang // gang dag da ltar sdud byed pa //
analyzed: bsdus dang sdud par 'gyur ba dang // gang dag da ltar sdud byed pa //
translated: Those who have gathered, are gathering, and will gather

original: de kun de 'dra de lta bas //
analyzed: de kun de 'dra de lta bas //
translated: all of them do so in this way.

original: 'di ni sems can smin byed lam //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can smin byed lam //
translated: This is the path for bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: 'dis ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dus gsum du yang bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam nyid yin par ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dus gsum du yang bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam nyid yin par ston te /
translated: This shows that the four means of gathering students are the sole path traversed by all those who bring sentient beings to full maturity in the three times.

original: lam gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no other path.

original: de ltar rtag tu longs spyod ma chags blo //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu longs spyod ma chags blo //
translated: Thus, with a mind that is never attached to enjoyments,🔽dwelling in the perfection of peace, discipline, and diligence,

original: zhi sdom brtson pa'i pha rol phyin gnas bdag / srid yul mtshan ma rnam par mi rtog pa //
analyzed: zhi sdom brtson pa'i pha rol phyin gnas bdag / srid yul mtshan ma rnam par mi rtog pa //
translated: the bodhisattva is free of concepts of existence, objects, and signs.

original: de ni sems can tshogs sdud byed pa yin /
analyzed: de ni sems can tshogs sdud byed pa yin /
translated: This is how he gathers a group of sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni ji skad du bshad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sbyor ba ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ji skad du bshad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sbyor ba ston te /
translated: This shows the bodhisattva's application of the means of gathering disciples, based on the six perfections as they have been explained.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dag dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dag gis go rims bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dag dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dag gis go rims bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfections and the means of gathering disciples accomplish the aims of self and other, respectively.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs rdzogs so //
translated: The chapter on the perfections is completed.🔽Seven verses on the analysis of worship of the buddhas:🔽1. With a mind of faith,

original: / sangs rgyas @211a * //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas @211a * //
translated: one should worship the buddhas, directly or not,

analyzed: la mchod pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa bdun te / rab dang sems dang ldan pa yis //
translated: with robes and so on,🔽in order to perfect the two stores.

original: tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: 2. The worship of the buddhas is complete🔽when one is endowed with aspiration,🔽when one does not objectify the three,🔽and when the appearance of the buddhas is not in vain.🔽3. The worship of the buddhas is complete🔽when one is endowed with aspiration,🔽when one does not objectify the three,

original: sangs rgyas rnams la gos sogs kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la gos sogs kyis //
translated: and when the appearance of the buddhas is not in vain.🔽4. The worship of the buddhas is complete🔽when one is endowed with aspiration,

original: mngon sum mngon sum min par mchod //
analyzed: mngon sum mngon sum min par mchod //
translated: when one does not objectify the three,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba don yod par //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba don yod par //
translated: and when the appearance of the buddhas is not in vain.🔽5. The worship of the buddhas is complete

original: smon lam dang ni ldan pa yi //
analyzed: smon lam dang ni ldan pa yi //
translated: when one is endowed with aspiration,🔽when one does not objectify the three,🔽and when the appearance of the buddhas is not in vain.🔽6. The worship of the buddhas is complete🔽when one is endowed with aspiration,

original: gsum po dmigs par mi byed pa //
analyzed: gsum po dmigs par mi byed pa //
translated: when one does not objectify the three,🔽and when the appearance of the buddhas is not in vain.🔽7. The worship of the buddhas is complete

original: sangs rgyas mchod pa rdzogs pa yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod pa rdzogs pa yin //
translated: when one is endowed with aspiration,

original: sems can dag ni tshad med pa //
analyzed: sems can dag ni tshad med pa //
translated: when one does not objectify the three,🔽and when the appearance of the buddhas is not in vain.

original: yongs su smin par byed pa gzhan //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pa gzhan //
translated: 1. The other is the one that brings to full maturity.

original: rdzas dang sems kyi sgo nas gzhan //
analyzed: rdzas dang sems kyi sgo nas gzhan //
translated: 2. The other is the one that is material and mental.🔽3. The other is the one that is faith, aspiration,

original: mos pa dang ni smon pa dang // brtse dang bzod pa dag dang ni //
analyzed: mos pa dang ni smon pa dang // brtse dang bzod pa dag dang ni //
translated: compassion, and patience.

analyzed: yang dag spyod pa'i sgo dang ni //

analyzed: gzhi la gtod dang rtogs pa dang // grol dang de bzhin nyid kyis gzhan //
translated: the one that is the dedication, the one that is the support, the one that is the substance, the one that is the cause,🔽6. the one that is the knowledge, the one that is the field,🔽and the one that is the abode.

original: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa 'di bzhis ni //
analyzed: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa 'di bzhis ni //
translated: Thus, these four verses🔽should be understood as showing the worship that is the reason, the worship that is the dedication,

original: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rten dang dngos dang rgyu dang ni //🔽ye shes dang ni zhing dag dang ; / gnas kyi mchod par ba bstan par //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ni yongs bsngo dang // rten dang dngos dang rgyu dang ni // ye shes dang ni zhing dag dang ; / gnas kyi mchod par ba bstan par //

original: rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig par bya ste /
translated: and the worship that is the abode.

analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan ni rab tu dang ba dang ldan pa'i sems so // yongs su bsngo ba ni /

analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The dedication is the one that brings to completion the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: rten ni mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: rten ni mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The support is the Buddhas, both manifest and unmanifest.

original: dngos po ni gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni gos la sogs pa'o //

original: rgyu ni bdag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba don yod par gyur cig ces sngon smon pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni bdag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba don yod par gyur cig ces sngon smon pa'o //
translated: The cause is the previous aspiration, “May it not be in vain that a Buddha has appeared in my world.

original: ye shes ni mchod par byed pa dang / mchod par bya ba dang / mchod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni mchod par byed pa dang / mchod par bya ba dang / mchod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: ” The intuition is non-conceptual, because it does not objectify the worshipper, the worshipped, and the worship.

original: zhing ni sems can tshad med pa rnams te /🔽de yongs su smin bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhing ni sems can tshad med pa rnams te / de yongs su smin bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de dag gis de la rab tu sbyor bas de dag la de btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one applies oneself to that in order to bring them to maturity, one plants that in them.

original: gnas ni rdzas dang sems te /
analyzed: gnas ni rdzas dang sems te /
translated: The basis is substance and mind.

original: de la rdzas la brten nas mchod pa ni gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdzas la brten nas mchod pa ni gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: Worship based on substance is with robes, etc.

translated: Worship based on mind is with mental orientations that savor the experience, rejoice, and delight, and with faith, etc., as previously explained.

original: theg pa chen po la mos pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la mos pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /

translated: Here, the verse is explained in terms of the aspiration itself, in terms of compassion for sentient beings, in terms of patience in the suffering of austerities, in terms of the practice of the perfections, and in terms of proper mental attention to the Dharma.

original: de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir gzhi la gtod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir gzhi la gtod pa yin no //
translated: That is the basis of the non-erroneous.

original: yang dag ba'i lta ba'i sgo nas ni mthong ba'i lam la ste /
analyzed: yang dag ba'i lta ba'i sgo nas ni mthong ba'i lam la ste /
translated: In terms of right view, it is on the path of seeing,

analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir gzhi rtogs pa yin no //
translated: because that is the realization of the basis as it is.
