translated: are the root, the supreme fruit, and the tree itself.

original: 'di ni snying rje'i ljon shing chen po yin //
analyzed: 'di ni snying rje'i ljon shing chen po yin //
translated: This is the great tree of compassion.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs pa'i snying rje'i shing yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs pa'i snying rje'i shing yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The tree of compassion should be understood as having roots, a trunk, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje'o //
translated: Its roots are compassion.

original: sdong po ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdong po ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Its trunk is patience.

original: yal ga ni sems can gyi don la sems pa'o //
analyzed: yal ga ni sems can gyi don la sems pa'o //
translated: Its branches are thoughts of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: lo ma ni skye ba bzang po dag tu smon pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma ni skye ba bzang po dag tu smon pa'o //
translated: Its leaves are prayers for good rebirths.

original: me tog ni skye ba bzang po'o //
analyzed: me tog ni skye ba bzang po'o //
translated: Its flowers are good rebirths.

original: 'bras bu ni sems can yongs @216b su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sems can yongs @216b su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: Its fruits are the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: rtsa ba snying rje med gyur na //
analyzed: rtsa ba snying rje med gyur na //
translated: If there were no root of compassion,

original: dka' spyod bzod pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dka' spyod bzod pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: there would be no patience with difficulties.

original: blo ldan sdug bsngal mi bzod na //
analyzed: blo ldan sdug bsngal mi bzod na //
translated: If the wise were not patient with suffering,

original: sems can don sems nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can don sems nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: they would not think of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems pa dang ni bral ba'i blo //🔽skye ba dkar po rnam dag tu //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni bral ba'i blo // skye ba dkar po rnam dag tu //
translated: If the mind were not accompanied by compassion,

original: smon lam 'debs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon lam 'debs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not make prayers for good rebirths.

original: skye ba bzang po ma thob na //
analyzed: skye ba bzang po ma thob na //
translated: If one did not obtain good rebirths,

original: sems can yongs smin byed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can yongs smin byed mi 'gyur //
translated: one would not bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni snga ma las phyi ma skye ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir snying rje la sogs pa rtsa ba la sogs pa'i dngos por sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni snga ma las phyi ma skye ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir snying rje la sogs pa rtsa ba la sogs pa'i dngos por sgrub par byed do //
translated: These two verses establish that compassion, etc. are roots, etc. because the later grow from the former, and because they are similar to roots, etc.

original: snying rje'i chu ba byams pa ste //
analyzed: snying rje'i chu ba byams pa ste //
translated: Love is the water for the tree of compassion,

original: de sdug bsngal na bde ba yis//🔽yangs rgyas tshul bzhin yid byed pas //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal na bde ba yis// yangs rgyas tshul bzhin yid byed pas //
translated: and the happiness of the bodhisattva who suffers🔽is the spreading of the branches.

original: yal ga rgya chen 'phel ba dang // smon lam rgyun ni ma bcad pas //🔽lo ma 'dor len rkyen rnam gnyis //
analyzed: yal ga rgya chen 'phel ba dang // smon lam rgyun ni ma bcad pas // lo ma 'dor len rkyen rnam gnyis //
translated: The growth of the branches is the increase of the extensive practices,🔽and the leaves are the conditions, the two kinds of conditions.

original: grub pa de phyir me tog dang // 'bras bu don yod shes par bya //
analyzed: grub pa de phyir me tog dang // 'bras bu don yod shes par bya //
translated: The flowers and fruits are the accomplishments,🔽and the continuity of the vow is the non-interruption.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni snying rje'i shing gi rtsa ba dang chub la sogs pa dang / chos mthun par ston par byed de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni snying rje'i shing gi rtsa ba dang chub la sogs pa dang / chos mthun par ston par byed de /
translated: These two verses show the similarity of the tree of compassion to a tree by its root, trunk, etc.

original: snying rje ni rtsa ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: snying rje ni rtsa ba yin par bshad do //
translated: Compassion is explained as the root.

original: de'i chu ba ni byams pa ste //
analyzed: de'i chu ba ni byams pa ste //
translated: Love is the water for the tree of compassion,

original: des de rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes it to grow.

original: byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni //
translated: One who has a loving mind

original: gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: suffers from the suffering of others.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la zhugs pa la snying rje'i sgo nas sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de las bde ba skyes pas yangs pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la zhugs pa la snying rje'i sgo nas sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de las bde ba skyes pas yangs pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, for the bodhisattva who is engaged in the welfare of sentient beings, the suffering that arises from compassion is surpassed by the happiness that arises from that.

original: bzod pa rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzod pa rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that patience is surpassed.

original: de ni sdong por bshad de /
analyzed: de ni sdong por bshad de /
translated: That is explained as the trunk.

original: sdong po ni yangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdong po ni yangs pa yin no //
translated: The trunk is vast.

original: theg pa chen po la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rnam pa mang pos yal ga 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rnam pa mang pos yal ga 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: The branches increase through the many kinds of proper mental attentions to the Great Vehicle.

original: sems pa ni yal ga zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems pa ni yal ga zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that intention is the branches.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma 'gag pa dang skye ba'i rim gyis smon lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pas smon lam rnams lo ma 'dor ba dang / len pa dang chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma 'gag pa dang skye ba'i rim gyis smon lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pas smon lam rnams lo ma 'dor ba dang / len pa dang chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: The leaves should be understood as corresponding to the vows, because the continuum of vows is uninterrupted through the process of cessation and arising of former and later vows.

original: nang ni rkyen grub pa ste /
analyzed: nang ni rkyen grub pa ste /
translated: The inner is the establishment of conditions.

original: rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa las me tog lta bu'i skye ba don yod par rig par bya'o //🔽phyi'i rkyen yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa las me tog lta bu'i skye ba don yod par rig par bya'o // phyi'i rkyen yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: One should understand that the birth of a bodhisattva, like a flower, is not meaningless, because it is the full development of one's own mental continuum.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa las 'bras bu lta bu sems can yongs su smin par byed pa don yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa las 'bras bu lta bu sems can yongs su smin par byed pa don yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The external condition is the full development of others' mental continua, because the ripening of sentient beings, like a crop, is not meaningless.🔽A verse on the benefit of compassion

original: snying rje'i phan yon gyi tshigs su bcad pa /🔽snying rje chen po yon tan @217a * //
analyzed: snying rje'i phan yon gyi tshigs su bcad pa / snying rje chen po yon tan @217a * //
translated: A verse on the benefits of compassion🔽Great compassion is the root of🔽

original: 'byung gnas kyi //
analyzed: 'byung gnas kyi //
translated: The source of all virtues

original: sems can rnams la snying rje su mi byed //🔽'di ltar 'di dag la ni sdug bsngal yang //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje su mi byed // 'di ltar 'di dag la ni sdug bsngal yang //
translated: is compassion for all sentient beings.🔽For from it comes immeasurable

original: brtses bskyed bde ba gzhal du med pa 'byung //
analyzed: brtses bskyed bde ba gzhal du med pa 'byung //
translated: happiness, even in this life.

original: 'dir snying rje chen po'i yon tan ni phyed 'og mas bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir snying rje chen po'i yon tan ni phyed 'og mas bstan te /
translated: Here the benefit of great compassion is shown in the second half of the verse.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: snying rje'i chags pa med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: snying rje'i chags pa med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the nonattachment of compassion🔽.

original: snying rjes zin pa'i brtser ldan rnams //
analyzed: snying rjes zin pa'i brtser ldan rnams //
translated: The compassionate, who are full of love,

original: zhi la'ang yid ni mi gnas na //
analyzed: zhi la'ang yid ni mi gnas na //
translated: do not even rest in the peace of nirvāṇa,🔽how could they rest in this life's pleasures?

original: 'jig rten bde dang rang srog la //
analyzed: 'jig rten bde dang rang srog la //
translated: For the sake of the world’s happiness and for my own life,🔽

original: chags par 'gyur ba smos ci dgos //
analyzed: chags par 'gyur ba smos ci dgos //
translated: What need be said of attachment to the happiness of the world and to one’s own life?

original: 'jig rten thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi bde ba dang / rang gi srog la chags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi bde ba dang / rang gi srog la chags so //
translated: The whole world is attached to the happiness of the world and to its own life.

original: de la yang chags pa med pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa la yid gnas so //
analyzed: de la yang chags pa med pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa la yid gnas so //
translated: But the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas, who are free from attachment, rest in the cessation of all suffering, in Nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rjes zin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yid mi gnas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rjes zin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yid mi gnas na /
translated: But the Bodhisattvas, because they are filled with compassion, do not even rest in Nirvana.

original: de dag la chags par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos ;
analyzed: de dag la chags par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos ;
translated: What need be said of their attachment to the happiness of the world and to their own lives?

original: snying rjes byams pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste //
analyzed: snying rjes byams pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste //
translated: Three verses on the superiority of the love of the compassionate

original: kha na ma tho med pa'i byams pa gang //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med pa'i byams pa gang //
translated: There is no love without offense,

original: de ni yod min 'jig rten pa yang min //
analyzed: de ni yod min 'jig rten pa yang min //
translated: nor is there any worldly love.

original: blo ldan rnams kyi brtse bas byams pa ni //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyi brtse bas byams pa ni //
translated: But the love of the wise, born of compassion,

original: kha na ma tho med cing 'jig rten 'das //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med cing 'jig rten 'das //
translated: is free from offense and transcends the world.

original: pha ma la sogs pa'i byams pa ni sred pa'i rang bzhin dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma la sogs pa'i byams pa ni sred pa'i rang bzhin dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The love of parents, etc. is of the nature of craving and is accompanied by sin.

original: 'jig rten pa'i snying rjes gnas pa rnams kyi kha na ma tho ba med kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snying rjes gnas pa rnams kyi kha na ma tho ba med kyang //
translated: The love of those who abide in mundane compassion is sinless,

original: 'jig rten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yin no //
translated: but it is mundane.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni snying rje'i rang bzhin dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang // 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni snying rje'i rang bzhin dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang // 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The love of the bodhisattvas is of the nature of compassion, is sinless, and is supramundane.

original: ji ltar kha na ma tho ba med pa yin zhe na /🔽sdug bsngal dba' rgal che dang mi shes pa'i /🔽mun pa che la rten par gyur pa yi //
analyzed: ji ltar kha na ma tho ba med pa yin zhe na / sdug bsngal dba' rgal che dang mi shes pa'i / mun pa che la rten par gyur pa yi //
translated: How is it sinless?

original: 'jig rten 'dren pa'i thabs gang yin pa de //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dren pa'i thabs gang yin pa de //
translated: The world is immersed in the great flood of suffering and the great darkness of ignorance.🔽What means could there be to rescue it

original: ji ltar kha na ma tho med mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar kha na ma tho med mi 'gyur //
translated: that would not be sinful?

original: sdug bsngal gyi dba' rgal chen po dang / mi shes pa'i mun pa chen po la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dba' rgal chen po dang / mi shes pa'i mun pa chen po la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The great flood of suffering and the great darkness of ignorance.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa yin zhe na /🔽'jig rten byang chub rang sangs rgyas pa yi //
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa yin zhe na / 'jig rten byang chub rang sangs rgyas pa yi //
translated: How is it supramundane?🔽That love does not exist for the world-transcending

original: dgra bcom rnams la byams pa de med na //
analyzed: dgra bcom rnams la byams pa de med na //
translated: Arhats, Pratyekabuddhas, and the enlightened

original: de las gzhan la smos kyang ci dgos pa //
analyzed: de las gzhan la smos kyang ci dgos pa //
translated: How much less for others!

original: ji ltar 'jig rten 'das pa ma yin 'gyur //🔽byang chub @217b so sor sangs rgyas pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten 'das pa ma yin 'gyur // byang chub @217b so sor sangs rgyas pa ni /
translated: How could it be supramundane?

original: byang chub rang sangs rgyas pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub rang sangs rgyas pa rnams so //
translated: Enlightened means enlightened by themselves.🔽The world-transcending love of the Bodhisattvas is not found in the Arhats, Pratyekabuddhas, and Buddhas enlightened by themselves.

original: lha ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lha ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the rest is selfevident.

original: skrag pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: skrag pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the reason for delight in fear

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal med //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal med //
translated: The Bodhisattva has no suffering,

original: brtse bas sdug bsngal 'gyur ba gang //
analyzed: brtse bas sdug bsngal 'gyur ba gang //
translated: but through his love he takes on suffering.

original: de la dang por kun tu skrag / reg nas shin tu mngon par dga' //
analyzed: de la dang por kun tu skrag / reg nas shin tu mngon par dga' //
translated: At first he is afraid of it, but when he has experienced it, he is overjoyed.

original: sdug bsngal med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med ces bya ba ni /
translated: He has no suffering means that he has no suffering for himself.

original: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But through his love he takes on suffering means that he has suffering for others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snying rje sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de la dang por ni kun tu skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snying rje sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de la dang por ni kun tu skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: The suffering of compassion that arises for bodhisattvas terrifies them at first,

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bdag dang gzhan mi mnyam pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bdag dang gzhan mi mnyam pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have not yet touched suffering with the reality of selflessness on the stage of action in faith.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sa la reg nas ni shin tu mngon bar dga'o //🔽snying rje'i sdug bsngal gyis bde ba zil gyis gnon pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sa la reg nas ni shin tu mngon bar dga'o // snying rje'i sdug bsngal gyis bde ba zil gyis gnon pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: But when they touch it on the stage of pure universal responsibility, they are filled with joy.🔽A verse on the superiority of the suffering of compassion

original: brtse bas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: brtse bas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal 'jig rten gyi //
translated: . The suffering that compassion produces

original: bde ba thams cad zil gyis gnon 'gyur zhing //🔽don byas rnams kyang de dang mi ldan gang //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad zil gyis gnon 'gyur zhing // don byas rnams kyang de dang mi ldan gang //
translated: surpasses all mundane happiness.

original: de las ngo mtshar che ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de las ngo mtshar che ba ci zhig yod //
translated: What is more amazing than that🔽those who have achieved their goal are not free of it?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rjes bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal nyid 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i bde ba gang yin pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de lta bu'i bde bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rjes bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal nyid 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i bde ba gang yin pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de lta bu'i bde bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The suffering that bodhisattvas generate through compassion becomes a happiness that surpasses all mundane happiness.

original: dgra bcom pa don byas pa rnams kyang bde ba de dang mi ldan na gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa gang yin pa de las ngo mtshar che ba ni med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa don byas pa rnams kyang bde ba de dang mi ldan na gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa gang yin pa de las ngo mtshar che ba ni med do //
translated: Since even arhats who have fulfilled their own goal do not have that happiness, what need is there to mention others? There is nothing more amazing than that.

original: snying rjes byas pa'i sbyin pa'i phan yon gyi tshigs su bcad pa /🔽brtan pa'i brtse dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa yis //
analyzed: snying rjes byas pa'i sbyin pa'i phan yon gyi tshigs su bcad pa / brtan pa'i brtse dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa yis //
translated: A verse on the benefit of generosity that is motivated by compassion🔽The happiness that the steadfast create through generosity

original: sbyin pa'i bde ba byed pa gang yin pa //🔽de la khams gsum nye bar spyad rnams kyi //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bde ba byed pa gang yin pa // de la khams gsum nye bar spyad rnams kyi //
translated: out of their compassion🔽is not equaled by the happiness of all the worlds

original: bde ba de yis char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: bde ba de yis char yang mi phod do //
translated: in their enjoyment of the three realms.

original: bde ba de la 'jig rten gsum gyi bde ba'i nye bar spyad pa rnams kyis bde ba byas pa gang yin pa des kyang char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba 'di ni phyed 'og ma'i don yin te /
analyzed: bde ba de la 'jig rten gsum gyi bde ba'i nye bar spyad pa rnams kyis bde ba byas pa gang yin pa des kyang char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba 'di ni phyed 'og ma'i don yin te /
translated: The bliss of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages is not even slightly equaled by the bliss of the gods in the three realms.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the second half of the verse is selfevident.

original: brtse bas sdug bsngal khas len pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /🔽sems can don phyir brtse bas sdug bsngal gyi //
analyzed: brtse bas sdug bsngal khas len pa'i tshigs su bcad pa / sems can don phyir brtse bas sdug bsngal gyi //
translated: A verse on the acceptance of suffering through compassion🔽.

original: rang bzhin 'khor ba gang yin mi gtong na //🔽snying rje can rnams gzhan la phan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'khor ba gang yin mi gtong na // snying rje can rnams gzhan la phan pa'i phyir //
translated: Out of tender love, the compassionate one does not abandon the cyclic existence which is by nature suffering for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal ci ste khas len byed mi 'gyur //🔽sdug bsngal thams cad ni 'khor ba'i @218a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ci ste khas len byed mi 'gyur // sdug bsngal thams cad ni 'khor ba'i @218a * //
translated: Why would the compassionate one not accept suffering for the sake of helping others?

original: sdug bsngal gyi khongs su gtogs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khongs su gtogs te /
translated: All suffering is included in the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de khas blangs pas sdug bsngal thams cad khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de khas blangs pas sdug bsngal thams cad khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By accepting that, all suffering is accepted.

original: gsum dang de dag gi 'bras bu 'phel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: gsum dang de dag gi 'bras bu 'phel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the increase of the three and their results

original: brtse dang ldan pa'i snying rje sbyin pa dang // longs spyod dang ni de las byams pa dang // rjes su bzung bas bskyed dang de yi mthus //
analyzed: brtse dang ldan pa'i snying rje sbyin pa dang // longs spyod dang ni de las byams pa dang // rjes su bzung bas bskyed dang de yi mthus //
translated: and wealth, and from that, love,🔽are produced by the power of his protection.

original: byams pa'i bde ba rtag tu 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: byams pa'i bde ba rtag tu 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: The happiness of love always increases.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la tshe rabs thams cad du gsum 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la tshe rabs thams cad du gsum 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: In all lives, the bodhisattvas always increase three things:

original: snying rje la goms pas snying rje dang / snying rje'i dbang gis sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i dbang gis longs spyod dag go //
analyzed: snying rje la goms pas snying rje dang / snying rje'i dbang gis sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i dbang gis longs spyod dag go //
translated: compassion, generosity, and wealth.

original: gsum po de dag las kyang 'bras bu bde ba rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: gsum po de dag las kyang 'bras bu bde ba rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
translated: From these three, three kinds of happiness arise as their fruits:

original: snying rje las byams pas bskyed pa dang / sbyin pa las sems can rjes su 'dzin pas bskyed pa dang / longs spyod dag las de rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i mthus byas pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje las byams pas bskyed pa dang / sbyin pa las sems can rjes su 'dzin pas bskyed pa dang / longs spyod dag las de rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i mthus byas pa'o //
translated: the happiness of love produced by compassion, the happiness of protecting beings produced by generosity, and the happiness of the power to protect produced by wealth.

original: sbyin pa la spro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa la spro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse of encouragement to generosity

original: snying rje rgyas par bya zhing 'phel bar bya //
analyzed: snying rje rgyas par bya zhing 'phel bar bya //
translated: One should increase compassion and expand it.

original: sbyin pas yongs smin bya zhing bde bar bya //
analyzed: sbyin pas yongs smin bya zhing bde bar bya //
translated: One should mature beings through generosity and make them happy.

original: kun tu drang bar bya zhing bkri bya zhes //🔽zhen pa rnams la rab tu smra dang 'dra //
analyzed: kun tu drang bar bya zhing bkri bya zhes // zhen pa rnams la rab tu smra dang 'dra //
translated: One should lead them everywhere and guide them.🔽For those who are attached to generosity, it is like a goad.

original: sbyin pa la zhen pa rnams la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la zhen pa rnams la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The meaning is that for those who are attached to generosity, compassion is like a goad.

original: snying rje ni yon tan drug po ngo bo nyid rgyas pa dang / longs spyod dag gis de spel ba dang / sbyin pas sems can smin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po'i bde ba bskyed pa dang / byang chub chen po'i tshogs kun tu 'dren pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje ni yon tan drug po ngo bo nyid rgyas pa dang / longs spyod dag gis de spel ba dang / sbyin pas sems can smin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po'i bde ba bskyed pa dang / byang chub chen po'i tshogs kun tu 'dren pa dang /
translated: Compassion has six virtues: it increases the very nature of compassion; it expands it through enjoyments; it matures beings through generosity; it produces the happiness of the giver; it leads to the accumulation of the great enlightenment;

original: byang chub chen po dang nye bar 'khrid pas byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la zhen pa rnams la spro ba bskyed ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po dang nye bar 'khrid pas byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la zhen pa rnams la spro ba bskyed ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: and it guides to the great enlightenment. Thus, compassion is like a goad for the bodhisattvas who are attached to generosity, since it stimulates them.

original: gzhan bde bas bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: gzhan bde bas bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: A verse on the experience of happiness through the happiness of others

original: snying rjes sdug bsngal dag gis sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: snying rjes sdug bsngal dag gis sdug bsngal ba //
translated: . Compassion suffers through the suffering of others.

original: bde ma bskyed par gang gis bde bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ma bskyed par gang gis bde bar 'gyur //
translated: How can one be happy without producing happiness?

original: de phyir brtse dang ldan pas gzhan bde ba //
analyzed: de phyir brtse dang ldan pas gzhan bde ba //
translated: Therefore, the compassionate one, having produced happiness in others,

original: bskyed nas bdag nyid bde bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: bskyed nas bdag nyid bde bar byed pa yin /
translated: makes himself happy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rjes gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dag gis sdug bsngal ba de ji ltar sems can rnams la bde ba ma bskyed par bde bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rjes gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dag gis sdug bsngal ba de ji ltar sems can rnams la bde ba ma bskyed par bde bar 'gyur /
translated: How can the Bodhisattva, who is suffering because of the suffering of others through compassion, be happy without producing happiness in sentient beings?

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems @218b dpa' ni gzhan dag la bde ba bskyed nas bdag nyid bde bar byed pa kho na'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems @218b dpa' ni gzhan dag la bde ba bskyed nas bdag nyid bde bar byed pa kho na'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva, having produced happiness in others, makes himself happy.

original: brtse bas sbyin pa la rjes su ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
analyzed: brtse bas sbyin pa la rjes su ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
translated: Six verses on the instruction in generosity out of love:

original: snying rje can ni rtag tu rang sbyin la //
analyzed: snying rje can ni rtag tu rang sbyin la //
translated: The compassionate one is always teaching generosity to himself,

original: ston dang 'dra ste rang bde mi 'dod pa //
analyzed: ston dang 'dra ste rang bde mi 'dod pa //
translated: like a teacher, not desiring his own happiness.

original: longs spyod rnams kyis gzhan dag bde bar gyis //
analyzed: longs spyod rnams kyis gzhan dag bde bar gyis //
translated: “Make others happy with enjoyments,

original: yang na tha dad min bde bdag la 'ang min //
analyzed: yang na tha dad min bde bdag la 'ang min //
translated: or else, like them, be unhappy.”

original: snying rje can bde ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba med na med de /
analyzed: snying rje can bde ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba med na med de /
translated: The compassionate one's happiness is not without the happiness of others.

original: de lta bas na bde ba tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na bde ba tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because happiness is not separate,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de med par bdag nyid sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bde ba mi 'dod do //🔽de bde bde ba bdag gis sbyin pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de med par bdag nyid sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bde ba mi 'dod do // de bde bde ba bdag gis sbyin pa ni //
translated: the bodhisattva does not desire the result of giving for himself without that.🔽Giving is giving to sentient beings

original: 'bras dang bcas te sems can rnams la byin //
analyzed: 'bras dang bcas te sems can rnams la byin //
translated: together with the result.

original: gal te khyod kyis bdag la bya ba yod //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis bdag la bya ba yod //
translated: If you have something to do for me,

original: de dag nyid la shin tu 'bras bur byos //
analyzed: de dag nyid la shin tu 'bras bur byos //
translated: make that very thing the result.🔽Since the happiness of those very beings is my happiness, I give the gift of giving happiness. I give the gift of giving to sentient beings together with the result of giving. Therefore, whatever results there are, you should know that all of them are to be made the result for those very beings.

original: gang phyir de dag bde ba nyid bdag gi bde ba yin pas bde ba sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa bdag gis sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de sems can rnams la sbyin pa de'i phyir 'bras bur bya ba ji snyed yod pa thams cad de dag kho na la 'bras bur bya bar rig par gyis shig ces byang chub sems dpa' snying rjes sbyin pa la rjes su ston to //
analyzed: gang phyir de dag bde ba nyid bdag gi bde ba yin pas bde ba sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa bdag gis sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de sems can rnams la sbyin pa de'i phyir 'bras bur bya ba ji snyed yod pa thams cad de dag kho na la 'bras bur bya bar rig par gyis shig ces byang chub sems dpa' snying rjes sbyin pa la rjes su ston to //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva teaches giving out of compassion.

original: sbyin pa po ni longs spyod mi 'dod kyang //
analyzed: sbyin pa po ni longs spyod mi 'dod kyang //
translated: The giver, though not desiring wealth,

original: longs spyod shin tu mang la bzang dang phrad /
analyzed: longs spyod shin tu mang la bzang dang phrad /
translated: finds himself with an abundance of excellent wealth.

original: bdag ni bde ba de 'dod ma yin te //
analyzed: bdag ni bde ba de 'dod ma yin te //
translated: I do not desire that happiness,

original: 'di ltar bdag ni sbyin la brgyud dang ldan //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni sbyin la brgyud dang ldan //
translated: for I am devoted to giving.

original: sbyin pa po longs spyod la rgyab kyis phyogs pa la longs spyod shin tu mang po dang / shin tu bzang po dag nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa po longs spyod la rgyab kyis phyogs pa la longs spyod shin tu mang po dang / shin tu bzang po dag nye bar gnas te /
translated: The giver who turns his back on wealth finds himself with an abundance of excellent wealth.

original: sems rgya che ba'i phyir de ni chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: sems rgya che ba'i phyir de ni chos nyid yin no //
translated: This is a natural consequence, because his mind is expansive.

original: bdag ni longs spyod dag de ltar nye bar gnas pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: bdag ni longs spyod dag de ltar nye bar gnas pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: I do not desire the happiness that comes from having wealth.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni de rgyun chags par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin pa la brgyud pa dang ldan pa yin gyis bde ba la ni ma yin no //🔽bdag ni rtag tu brtse bas bdog pa kun //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni de rgyun chags par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin pa la brgyud pa dang ldan pa yin gyis bde ba la ni ma yin no // bdag ni rtag tu brtse bas bdog pa kun //
translated: For I am devoted to giving, because I desire that it continue. I am not devoted to happiness.🔽I am always giving everything out of compassion.

original: yongs su gtong ba gang yin de ltos la //
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba gang yin de ltos la //
translated: Look at me!🔽Therefore, you should not expect

original: des na khyod kyis bdag ni de'i 'bras la //
analyzed: des na khyod kyis bdag ni de'i 'bras la //
translated: any reward from me.

original: don gnyer med pa nyid du shes par bya //
analyzed: don gnyer med pa nyid du shes par bya //
translated: You should understand that I have no interest in the fruits of generosity.

original: bdag ni rtag tu snying rjes sbyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad yongs su gtong ba de nyid kyi phyir khyod kyis bdag la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba med pa nyid du rig par @219a * //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag tu snying rjes sbyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad yongs su gtong ba de nyid kyi phyir khyod kyis bdag la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba med pa nyid du rig par @219a * //
translated: “Because I always give away all the fruits of generosity out of compassion, you should understand that I have no interest in the fruits of generosity.”

original: bya'o ; / zhes byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su ston par byed do //
analyzed: bya'o ; / zhes byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su ston par byed do //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva teaches generosity.

original: gal te khyod 'bras thob pa mi gtong na //
analyzed: gal te khyod 'bras thob pa mi gtong na //
translated: If you don’t give away the fruits you have obtained,

original: sbyin la mngon dga' yin par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: sbyin la mngon dga' yin par mi 'gyur te //
translated: you will not be one who delights in generosity.

original: 'di ltar skad cig tsam yang sbyin med na //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig tsam yang sbyin med na //
translated: For if you don’t give even for a moment,

original: sbyin la mngon par dga' ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: sbyin la mngon par dga' ba nyid ma yin //
translated: you are not one who delights in generosity.

original: zhes bya ba ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of this verse is self-evident.

original: ma byas pa la 'bras bu mi 'byin te //
analyzed: ma byas pa la 'bras bu mi 'byin te //
translated: You do not give fruits to those who have not given to you.

original: 'di ltar lan bltas bdag gi cha ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar lan bltas bdag gi cha ma yin //
translated: For it is not my way to look for repayment.

original: khyod ni gang zhig khyod byed pa de la 'bras bu 'byin te /
analyzed: khyod ni gang zhig khyod byed pa de la 'bras bu 'byin te /
translated: You give fruits to those who have given to you.

original: de lta bas na lan la lta bas bdag gi cha ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na lan la lta bas bdag gi cha ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not my nature to look for a reward.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni /
translated: But you,

original: khyod kyi lan la lta dang bral bas na //
analyzed: khyod kyi lan la lta dang bral bas na //
translated: since you are free of looking for a reward,

original: 'bras bu shin tu gzhan la gtong ba yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu shin tu gzhan la gtong ba yin //
translated: you give the fruit to others.

original: 'di ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is selfevident.

original: brtse bas sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: brtse bas sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on giving through sympathy.

original: rgyal sras rnams kyi brtse bas sbyin pa ni //
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyi brtse bas sbyin pa ni //
translated: The giving through sympathy of the victors' spiritual offspring

original: kha na ma tho med cing dag pa'i gzhi //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med cing dag pa'i gzhi //
translated: is irreproachable, has a pure basis,

original: bde ba 'dren par byed pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: bde ba 'dren par byed pa nyid dang ni //
translated: brings happiness,

original: rjes su bsrung bcas tshol med gos pa med //
analyzed: rjes su bsrung bcas tshol med gos pa med //
translated: is protective, disinterested, and unattached.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa ni gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa ni gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is irreproachable, because it does not harm others.

original: gzhi dag pa ni dug dang mtshon dang chang la sogs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas dngos po rung ba sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi dag pa ni dug dang mtshon dang chang la sogs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas dngos po rung ba sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has a pure basis, because it gives suitable things, avoiding poison, weapons, intoxicants, and the like.

original: bde ba bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba bskyed pa ni /
translated: It brings happiness,

original: sbyin pas kun tu bsdus nas dge ba la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas kun tu bsdus nas dge ba la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it attracts beings through generosity and then benefits them by means of the three vehi cles.

original: rjes su bsrung ba dang bcas pa ni 'khor gyi skye bo la mi gnod par gzhan la sbyin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshol ba med pa ni ma bslangs kyang don du gnyer ba nyid dam /
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba dang bcas pa ni 'khor gyi skye bo la mi gnod par gzhan la sbyin pa'i phyir ro // tshol ba med pa ni ma bslangs kyang don du gnyer ba nyid dam /
translated: It is accompanied by protection because it gives to others without harming the people in one's retinue.

original: phongs par khong du chud nas bdag nyid kyis sbyin pa'i phyir dang / yon gnas mi 'dam pa'i phyir ro //🔽gos pa med pa ni /
analyzed: phongs par khong du chud nas bdag nyid kyis sbyin pa'i phyir dang / yon gnas mi 'dam pa'i phyir ro // gos pa med pa ni /
translated: It is without seeking because one gives by oneself, having understood the need of those who do not request, or because one does not seek a patron.

original: lan dang rnam par smin pa la dga' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan dang rnam par smin pa la dga' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unsoiled because one does not delight in reward or evolutionary development.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rgyal sras rnams kyi brtse bas sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyi brtse bas sbyin pa ni /
translated: the generosity of the bodhisattvas, out of compassion,🔽is complete, vast, preeminent, constant,🔽joyful, disinterested, and pure,

original: mtha' dag rgya che gtso dang rtag pa dang // dga' dang zang zing med dang dag pa dang // byang chub la gzhol dge la gzhol ba yin //
analyzed: mtha' dag rgya che gtso dang rtag pa dang // dga' dang zang zing med dang dag pa dang // byang chub la gzhol dge la gzhol ba yin //
translated: directed toward enlightenment and directed toward virtue.

original: de la mtha' dag ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtha' dag ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is complete because it gives both inner and outer things.

original: rgya chen po ni dngos po mang po sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya chen po ni dngos po mang po sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is vast because it gives many things.

original: gtso bo ni dngos po gya nom pa sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ni dngos po gya nom pa sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The principal is the gift of excellent things.

original: rtag pa ni yang dang yang du sbyin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dga' ba ni so sor brtags @219b pa med par rab tu dga' bas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni yang dang yang du sbyin pa'i phyir ro // dga' ba ni so sor brtags @219b pa med par rab tu dga' bas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The constant is the gift given again and again.🔽The joyful is the gift given with unfeigned joy.

original: zang zing med pa ni gos pa med pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zang zing med pa ni gos pa med pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The disinterested is the gift given without desire for any reward.

original: dag pa ni gzhi dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dag pa ni gzhi dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The pure is the gift given with a pure attitude.

original: byang chub la gzhol ba ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub la gzhol ba ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The gift directed to enlightenment is the gift dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: dge ba la gzhol ba ni bde ba bskyed pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba la gzhol ba ni bde ba bskyed pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The gift directed to virtue is the gift which produces happiness.

original: nye bar spyod pa'i khyad par gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i khyad par gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the excellence of enjoyment

original: ji ltar bde ba gsum gyis tshim pa'i yid //🔽brtse ldan yongs su gtong bas dga' 'gyur bas //🔽longs spyod can dag nye bar spyod pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba gsum gyis tshim pa'i yid // brtse ldan yongs su gtong bas dga' 'gyur bas // longs spyod can dag nye bar spyod pa yis //
translated: The compassionate one, satisfied by the three kinds of satisfaction,🔽rejoices in giving,🔽but the enjoyer does not rejoice in enjoyment

original: de ltar dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: to the same extent as the compassionate one rejoices in giving.

original: de la bde ba gsum ni sbyin pas dga' ba dang ; gzhan rjes su 'dzin pas dga' ba dang // byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba gsum ni sbyin pas dga' ba dang ; gzhan rjes su 'dzin pas dga' ba dang // byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of joy are the joy of generosity, the joy of caring for others, and the joy of completing the stores for enlightenment.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i snying rje'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i snying rje'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: A verse on the compassion of the bodhisattva who is accomplishing the transcendences

original: bkren la brtse dang ma rungs pa la brtse //
analyzed: bkren la brtse dang ma rungs pa la brtse //
translated: He is compassionate toward the miserly, compassionate toward the immoral,

original: kun 'khrugs la brtse bag med rnams la brtse //
analyzed: kun 'khrugs la brtse bag med rnams la brtse //
translated: compassionate toward the violent, compassionate toward the careless,

original: yul gyi gzhan dbang can la snying rje dang // log par mngon par zhen la snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: yul gyi gzhan dbang can la snying rje dang // log par mngon par zhen la snying rje ba'o //
translated: compassionate toward those dominated by objects, and compassionate toward those who are wrongly intent.

original: de la bkren pa ni ser sna can rnams so //
analyzed: de la bkren pa ni ser sna can rnams so //
translated: The miserly are those who are stingy.

original: ma rungs pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba gzhan la gnod pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma rungs pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba gzhan la gnod pa rnams so //
translated: The immoral are those who violate morality and harm others.

original: kun tu 'khrugs pa ni khro ba can rnams so //
analyzed: kun tu 'khrugs pa ni khro ba can rnams so //
translated: The violent are those who are angry.

original: bag med pa ni le lo can rnams so //
analyzed: bag med pa ni le lo can rnams so //
translated: The careless are those who are lazy.

original: yul gyi gzhan dbang can ni 'dod pa dag la sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yul gyi gzhan dbang can ni 'dod pa dag la sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams so //
translated: Those dominated by objects are those whose minds are distracted by sensual pleasures.

original: log par mngon par zhen pa ni /
analyzed: log par mngon par zhen pa ni /
translated: Wrong adherence is

original: shes rab 'chal ba mu stegs can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba mu stegs can la sogs pa'o //
translated: the perversely-inclined, such as the heterodox.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa 'di dag la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa 'di dag la /
translated: These who abide in the resistances to the transcendences

original: snying rje ba gang yin pa de ni bkren pa la sogs pa la snying rje ba yin te /
analyzed: snying rje ba gang yin pa de ni bkren pa la sogs pa la snying rje ba yin te /
translated: are the objects of the compassion of the bodhisattva.

original: de yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that compassion, by its removal of resistances, causes the achievement of the transcendences.

original: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i snying rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i snying rje zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus it is called the compassion that achieves the transcendences.

original: snying rje'i rkyen bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: snying rje'i rkyen bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the conditions of compassion🔽1. The bodhisattvas compassion arises from the cause, the spiritual gene,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal de rgyu las //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal de rgyu las //
translated: from happiness and from suffering, and from the teaching.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ste //
translated: The bodhisattvas compassion arises from the cause, the spiritual gene,

original: rgyu dang bshes gnyen rang bzhin las //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bshes gnyen rang bzhin las // byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'o //
translated: from the friend, and from the nature of things.

original: de la phyed gong mas ni snying rje'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ston te /
analyzed: de la phyed gong mas ni snying rje'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ston te /
translated: The first half of this verse shows the objective condition of compassion.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum la dmigs nas sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyis snying rje bar @220a * //🔽byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum la dmigs nas sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyis snying rje bar @220a * // byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion is generated by observing the three kinds of feelings, and by the three kinds of suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gi rgyu yin te /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain is the cause of pleasure and pain,

original: yang de dag 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de dag 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to the production of those two.

original: phyed 'og mas ni go rims bzhin du rgyu dang shes gnyen dang rang bzhin dag gis snying rje'i rgyu dang bdag po dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnams ston to //
analyzed: phyed 'og mas ni go rims bzhin du rgyu dang shes gnyen dang rang bzhin dag gis snying rje'i rgyu dang bdag po dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnams ston to //
translated: The second half shows the cause, the dominant influence, and the equivalent and immediate antecedent of compassion, respectively.

original: snying rje chen po nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on great compassion

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ni //
translated: The compassion of the bodhisattva

original: mnyam par shes bya de bsam phyir //
analyzed: mnyam par shes bya de bsam phyir //
translated: should be recognized as equal,🔽because of its universality, its universality of realm, its universality of stage,

original: sgrub phyir 'dod chags bral phyir dang // mi dmigs phyir dang dag phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub phyir 'dod chags bral phyir dang // mi dmigs phyir dang dag phyir ro //
translated: and its universality of direct realization.🔽It is equal because of universality of realm, because it has all realms for its object.🔽It is equal because of universality of stage, because it has all stages for its object.🔽It is equal because of universality of direct realization, because it has the direct realization of universality for its object.

original: de la mnyam pa ni tshor ba rnam pa gsum car gyi gnas skabs su gang ci tshor ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bar rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mnyam pa ni tshor ba rnam pa gsum car gyi gnas skabs su gang ci tshor ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bar rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The equality of compassion is because one knows that whatever is felt in any of the three kinds of feelings is suffering.

original: de yang bsam pa'i phyir ni sems kyis snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bsam pa'i phyir ni sems kyis snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion is cultivated through will, through the will to have compassion.

original: sgrub pa'i phyir ni de yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i phyir ni de yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cultivated through practice, through the practice of protecting them.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'tshe ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'tshe ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cultivated through freedom from addictions, through the abandonment of violence, which is its counteragent.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ni bdag dang gzhan dang snying rjer mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ni bdag dang gzhan dang snying rjer mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cultivated through nonapprehending, through the nonapprehension of self, other, and compassion.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni /
translated: It is cultivated through purification,

original: sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: through the attainment of tolerance of the noncreation of things on the eighth stage.

original: rang gi sems kyi byams la sogs //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi byams la sogs //
translated: Love, etc. are cultivated in one's own mind.

original: bsgom pa chos la mos pa dang // bsam dang dbang 'byor nyid dang ni //
analyzed: bsgom pa chos la mos pa dang // bsam dang dbang 'byor nyid dang ni //
translated: Faith in the Dharma, will, and mastery are the causes of their arising.

original: rnam par mi rtog gcig phyir mchog / ces bya ba'i don ni gang du bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs te khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog gcig phyir mchog / ces bya ba'i don ni gang du bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs te khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse should be understood according to the explanation.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das la dang ba rab skyes shing //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das la dang ba rab skyes shing //
translated: Thus, having generated intense faith in the Lord,

original: rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos shin tu rgyun mchod ldan //
analyzed: rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos shin tu rgyun mchod ldan //
translated: and having made offerings to him with great material and reverential worship,

original: yon tan mang ldan phan byed bshes la rtag bsten pa //
analyzed: yon tan mang ldan phan byed bshes la rtag bsten pa //
translated: always relying on the friend who has many good qualities and is helpful,

original: 'gro la rjes su brtse ba grub pa kun thob 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro la rjes su brtse ba grub pa kun thob 'gyur //
translated: one who has compassion for the world attains all perfections.

original: 'dis ni ji skad bshad pa'i mchod pa dang bstan pa dang tshad med pa rnams kyi go rims dang yon tan mdor bsdus nas ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ji skad bshad pa'i mchod pa dang bstan pa dang tshad med pa rnams kyi go rims dang yon tan mdor bsdus nas ston te /
translated: This verse shows in brief the order and good qualities of the worship, service, and the immeasurables as they have been explained.

original: rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos shin tu rtag tu mchod pa ni rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos shin tu rgyun du mchod pa dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos shin tu rtag tu mchod pa ni rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos shin tu rgyun du mchod pa dang ldan pa ste //
translated: One who has made offerings to him with great material and reverential worship always and intensely has made offerings to him with great material and reverential worship always and intensely.

original: bkur sti ni yang dag pa'i sgrub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni yang dag pa'i sgrub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Reverence should be understood as correct practice.

original: de ltar na rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with the worship of gain, honor, and practice.

original: yon tan mang po dang ldan pa ni de las gzhan pa dag dang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan mang po dang ldan pa ni de las gzhan pa dag dang ngo //
translated: Endowed with many virtues means endowed with the others.

original: phan par byed pa ni rjes su brtse bar byed pa nyid @220b kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pa ni rjes su brtse bar byed pa nyid @220b kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Beneficial means to be known through the quality of being compassionate.

original: grub pa kun thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don grub pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa kun thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don grub pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He attains all perfections means he attains the perfection of benefit for self and other.

original: mchod pa dang bstan pa dang tshad med pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: mchod pa dang bstan pa dang tshad med pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the section on worship, teaching, and the immeasurables.🔽Sixteen verses on shamelessness

original: // / ngo tsha ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ste //🔽ngo tsha mi mthun phyogs spangs dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: // / ngo tsha ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ste // ngo tsha mi mthun phyogs spangs dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: Shamelessness is the opposite of that.🔽It is associated with the addictions,🔽and is the basis of laziness.🔽It is the cause of not regretting and not stopping vile actions that have been done, and of not avoiding vile actions that have not been done.🔽It is the basis of not respecting and not revering.

original: kha na ma tho med dman yul //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med dman yul //
translated: It is the cause of not avoiding the realm of unfortunate rebirth.

original: sems can smin byed brtan pa'i yin //
analyzed: sems can smin byed brtan pa'i yin //
translated: It is the cause of not attaining the perfections of the stable.

original: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / dmigs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / dmigs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: This shows the four aspects of the bodhisattva's sense of shame: excellence of essence, excellence of friend, excellence of object, and excellence of activity.

original: yul kha na ma tho ba med cing dman pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
analyzed: yul kha na ma tho ba med cing dman pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
translated: The inferior object is the Sravakayana and Pratyekabuddhayana, which are not reprehensible.

original: de ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yang yin la /
translated: They are not reprehensible,

original: theg pa chen po bas dman pa yang yin pas des kyang byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bas dman pa yang yin pas des kyang byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha'o //
translated: but the bodhisattva is ashamed of them because they are inferior to the Mahayana.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed ce na //
translated: How does he bring beings to maturity?

original: ngo tsha ba de nyid la gzhan dag rab tu 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba de nyid la gzhan dag rab tu 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By establishing them in that very sense of shame.🔽The bodhisattva has an extreme sense of shame🔽when the resistances increase and the remedies diminish

original: pha rol phyin pa drug po yi //🔽mi mthun phyogs ni 'phel ba dang // gnyen po 'grib pas byang chub sems //🔽mi bzad ngo tsha skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa drug po yi //🔽mi mthun phyogs ni 'phel ba dang // gnyen po 'grib pas byang chub sems //🔽mi bzad ngo tsha skye bar 'gyur //
translated: with regard to the six transcendences.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pas ngo tsha ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pas ngo tsha ba yin te /
translated: This is the shame of the bodhisattvas with regard to increase and decrease.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'phel ba dang / de'i gnyen po yongs su 'grib pas shin tu ngo tsha ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'phel ba dang / de'i gnyen po yongs su 'grib pas shin tu ngo tsha ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They feel very ashamed when the resistances to the transcendences increase and their remedies decrease.🔽The steadfast feel shame🔽in relying on the six transcendences,

original: brtan rnams pha rol phyin pa drug / bsten pa la ni le lo dang // nyon mongs rjes su mthun chos la //🔽sbyor ba las kyang ngo tshar 'gyur //
analyzed: brtan rnams pha rol phyin pa drug / bsten pa la ni le lo dang // nyon mongs rjes su mthun chos la // sbyor ba las kyang ngo tshar 'gyur //
translated: in being lazy, and in applying themselves🔽to things that are not conducive to enlightenment.

original: 'di ni mi sbyor ba dang sbyor bas ngo tsha ba yin te /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la mi sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i chos dbang po'i sgom bsdams pa la sogs pa la sbyor bas ngo tsha ba skye ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'di ni mi sbyor ba dang sbyor bas ngo tsha ba yin te / pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la mi sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i chos dbang po'i sgom bsdams pa la sogs pa la sbyor bas ngo tsha ba skye ba'i phyir ro /
translated: This is their shame with regard to non application and application.

original: mnyam gzhag ngo bo nyid min chung //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag ngo bo nyid min chung //
translated: They feel ashamed when they do not apply themselves to cultivating the transcendences and when they do apply themselves to things that are not conducive to enlightenment, such as not restraining the sensory faculties.🔽They feel shame with regard to🔽non meditative equipoise,🔽the lesser stage,

original: 'bring dang dman pa'i sa pa dang // bsam pa dman dang ngar bcas pa'i //
analyzed: 'bring dang dman pa'i sa pa dang // bsam pa dman dang ngar bcas pa'i //
translated: and the inferior attitude.

original: ngo tsha dman de las gzhan lhag /'di ni ngo tsha ba chung du dang chen po ste /🔽tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: ngo tsha dman de las gzhan lhag /'di ni ngo tsha ba chung du dang chen po ste / tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni /
translated: The other is the opposite of that, and is greater.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this verse should be understood according to the explanation given above.

original: 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang gsum gyis go rims bzhin du ngo tsha ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / ngo tsha ba'i skyon dang / yon tan gyi dbye ba ston @221a * //
analyzed: 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang gsum gyis go rims bzhin du ngo tsha ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / ngo tsha ba'i skyon dang / yon tan gyi dbye ba ston @221a * //
translated: The following four verses, respectively, show the disadvantage of shamelessness, the advantage of shame, the classification of shame, and the classification of its excellences.

original: to ; / blo ldan ngo tsha med pa ni //
analyzed: to ; / blo ldan ngo tsha med pa ni //
translated: The wise are shameless🔽Because of their improper indulgence in the addictions,

original: tshul bzhin min pas nyon mongs dag / dang du len cing khong khro dang // yal bar 'dor dang nga rgyal gyis //
analyzed: tshul bzhin min pas nyon mongs dag / dang du len cing khong khro dang // yal bar 'dor dang nga rgyal gyis //
translated: their anger, their abandonment of beings, and their pride.

original: sems can rnams dang tshul khrims 'joms //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang tshul khrims 'joms //
translated: They destroy the morality of beings.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag nyid la yang gnod par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag nyid la yang gnod par byed la /
translated: This shows that the shameless destroy themselves,

original: gzhan la yang gnod par byed /🔽gnyi ga la yang gnod par byed ces bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan la yang gnod par byed /🔽gnyi ga la yang gnod par byed ces bstan to //
translated: destroy others,🔽and destroy both themselves and others.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin bzhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin bzhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas so //
translated: “Inappropriate attention” is attention that is not in accord with reality.

original: yal bar 'dor bas ji ltar sems can rnams 'joms she na /
analyzed: yal bar 'dor bas ji ltar sems can rnams 'joms she na /
translated: How do they destroy sentient beings by negligence?

original: sems can gyi don la bag med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'gyod pas nyams dang bcas 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la bag med pa'i phyir ro // 'gyod pas nyams dang bcas 'gyur zhing //
translated: Because they are heedless of the welfare of sentient beings.🔽They are depressed by regret,

original: bkur stis dman pa 'thob 'gyur des //
analyzed: bkur stis dman pa 'thob 'gyur des //
translated: and they obtain contempt from others.

original: dad ldan mi min tshogs dang ni //
analyzed: dad ldan mi min tshogs dang ni //
translated: The hosts of faithful nonhuman beings

original: ston pas kyang ni btang snyoms mdzad //
analyzed: ston pas kyang ni btang snyoms mdzad //
translated: and the Teacher are indifferent to them.

original: rgyal sras chos dang mthun rnams kyis //🔽rnam par smod cing 'jig rten las //
analyzed: rgyal sras chos dang mthun rnams kyis // rnam par smod cing 'jig rten las //
translated: The Dharma rejects the offspring of victors

original: mthong ba'i chos la mi snyan 'thob //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mi snyan 'thob //
translated: who are in accord with the Dharma.🔽In this life they obtain disrepute

original: gzhan du phyir zhing mi khom skye //
analyzed: gzhan du phyir zhing mi khom skye //
translated: and in other lives they are born in unfree states.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis mi mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma tho ba 'phel lo zhes ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis mi mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma tho ba 'phel lo zhes ston te /
translated: This shows the increase of the demerit that is not seen in this life.

original: go rims bzhin du bdag nyid dang // gzhan dang lha dang ston pa dag smod pa'i phyir dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dang / chos nyid kyis rnam par smod pa'i phyir dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su yang sdig pa can gyi mi snyan pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bdag nyid dang // gzhan dang lha dang ston pa dag smod pa'i phyir dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dang / chos nyid kyis rnam par smod pa'i phyir dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su yang sdig pa can gyi mi snyan pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the reproach of the wise companions in the celibate life, and because of the reproach of reality, and because of the infamy that spreads in all directions.

original: gzhan du phyir zhing mi khom skye //
analyzed: gzhan du phyir zhing mi khom skye //
translated: Otherwise, one is born again in the unfavorable states.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel lo zhes bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel lo zhes bstan te /
translated: This shows the increase of demerit in the next world.

original: mi khom pa rnams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi khom pa rnams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is born in the unfavorable states.

original: des na chos dkar thob pa dang / ma thob pa las rnam nyams 'gyur ;
analyzed: des na chos dkar thob pa dang / ma thob pa las rnam nyams 'gyur ;
translated: Therefore, one falls away from the possession and non-possession of the virtuous qualities.

original: / zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel lo zhes bstan te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel lo zhes bstan te /
translated: This shows the increase of demerit in the present life.

original: dge ba'i chos thob pa las yongs su nyams pa dang / ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thob pa las yongs su nyams pa dang / ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: from the loss of the acquisition of virtuous qualities, and from the loss of the non-acquisition of virtuous qualities, respectively.

original: de phyir sdug bsngal gnas pa dang // yid kyang rnal du mi gnas 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir sdug bsngal gnas pa dang // yid kyang rnal du mi gnas 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, he dwells in suffering, and his mind does not rest in equipoise.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni de las skyes pa'i sems kyi sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //🔽rgyal sras ngo tsha ldan rnams la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni de las skyes pa'i sems kyi sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // rgyal sras ngo tsha ldan rnams la //
translated: This shows that he experiences mental suffering and mental distress born from that.

original: nyes pa 'di dag kun mi 'byung //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di dag kun mi 'byung //
translated: All these faults never occur🔽in the victors’ offspring who have a sense of shame.

original: zhes bya ba 'di nas bzung ste ngo tsha ba'i yon tan yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nas bzung ste ngo tsha ba'i yon tan yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: From here on, the qualities of a sense of shame should be understood.

original: 'di ltar nyes pa 'di @221b dag kyang mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyes pa 'di @221b dag kyang mi 'byung bas so //
translated: Because these faults do not occur.🔽The wise are always reborn

original: mkhas pa rtag tu lha dag dang // mi rnams su ni yang dag skye //
analyzed: mkhas pa rtag tu lha dag dang // mi rnams su ni yang dag skye //
translated: among gods and humans.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
