analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs sogs bsdus //
translated: and by the inclusion of concentrations, retentions, and so on.

original: sems can smin par byed pa dang // dam chos 'dzin par byed pa'ang yin //
analyzed: sems can smin par byed pa dang // dam chos 'dzin par byed pa'ang yin //
translated: It also brings beings to maturity and upholds the sacred Dharma.

original: de la bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi gzhi ni rig pa'i gnas lnga ste ;
analyzed: de la bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi gzhi ni rig pa'i gnas lnga ste ;
translated: The basis of the knowledge of the treatises is the five branches of learning:

original: nang rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa'o //
analyzed: nang rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa'o //
translated: inner science, logic, grammar, the healing arts, and the artistic and practical crafts.

original: ched du bya ba ni /
analyzed: ched du bya ba ni /
translated: The purpose is

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'o //
translated: to accomplish one's own and others' goals.

original: las ni gzhi dang po la bdag nyid sgrub cing gzhan dag la yang de yang dag par ston pa dang / gnyis pa la de'i skyon yongs su shes shing pha rol rgol ba tshar bcad pa dang / gsum pa la bdag nyid nges pa'i tshig bzang po brjod cing gzhan yid ches par byed pa dang /
analyzed: las ni gzhi dang po la bdag nyid sgrub cing gzhan dag la yang de yang dag par ston pa dang / gnyis pa la de'i skyon yongs su shes shing pha rol rgol ba tshar bcad pa dang / gsum pa la bdag nyid nges pa'i tshig bzang po brjod cing gzhan yid ches par byed pa dang /
translated: As for its functions, on the first basis, one accomplishes one's own goal by training in the inner science and one accomplishes the goals of others by teaching it to them. On the second basis, one understands the defects of the inner science and refutes the arguments of opponents. On the third basis, one expresses oneself well in one's own language and one convinces others.

original: bzhi pa la gzhan dag gi nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / lnga pa la gzhan dag la de bgo bsha' byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la gzhan dag gi nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / lnga pa la gzhan dag la de bgo bsha' byed pa'o //
translated: On the fourth basis, one cures others' illnesses and on the fifth, one shares one's knowledge with others.

original: bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhi lnga po 'di dag nyid thos shing 'dzin pa dang / tshig gis byang ba dang / yid kyis brtag pa dang / mthong bas legs par rtogs pa dag yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhi lnga po 'di dag nyid thos shing 'dzin pa dang / tshig gis byang ba dang / yid kyis brtag pa dang / mthong bas legs par rtogs pa dag yin te /
translated: The definition of the knowledge of the treatises is these five bases, which are heard and retained, recited verbally, examined mentally, and well understood by insight.

original: thos nas go rims bzhin du de 'dzin pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ci rigs par de dag gi skyon dang yon tan khong du chud pa'i sgo nas rab tu dang pa'i yid kyis don sems pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang nyes par bshad pa dmigs phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos nas go rims bzhin du de 'dzin pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ci rigs par de dag gi skyon dang yon tan khong du chud pa'i sgo nas rab tu dang pa'i yid kyis don sems pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang nyes par bshad pa dmigs phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having heard them, one retains them, recites them verbally, and with a clear mind one reflects on their meaning, in order to understand their faults and virtues, and one well understands them by distinguishing what is well explained and what is not well explained.

original: mi zad pa nyid ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zad pa nyid ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are inexhaustible because they are not exhausted even in the nirvana without remainder.

original: 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: The perfect accomplishment of the result is the knowledge of all aspects of all things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bstan bcos shes pa nyid de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dag dang / gzungs kyi sgo dag gis bsdus la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bstan bcos shes pa nyid de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dag dang / gzungs kyi sgo dag gis bsdus la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: The treatises of the bodhisattvas are included in the doors of concentration and the doors of retention, and they also bring beings to full maturity.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dag nas de'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dag nas de'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, by means of the doors of concentration, one accomplishes the work of the treatises.

original: dam pa'i chos 'dzin par byed pa @223b yang yin te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'dzin par byed pa @223b yang yin te /
translated: And they also hold the holy Dharma,

original: gzungs dag gis de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzungs dag gis de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for by means of the retentions one holds the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten shes pa nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
translated: Four verses on the knowledge of the world.

original: brtan rnams 'jig rten shes pa nyid //
analyzed: brtan rnams 'jig rten shes pa nyid //
translated: The steadfast are unequaled in the world

original: lus dang ngag dang yid dang ni //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid dang ni //
translated: in physical, verbal, and mental knowledge of the world,

original: bden ba shes pas mnyam pa med //
analyzed: bden ba shes pas mnyam pa med //
translated: and in the knowledge of the truth.

original: de la gzhan pa dag las 'phags //
analyzed: de la gzhan pa dag las 'phags //
translated: They surpass all others.

original: ji ltar lus kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyis she na /
translated: How are they unequaled in physical knowledge of the world?

original: bshad pa ; brtan rnams rtag tu 'dzum par byed //
analyzed: bshad pa ; brtan rnams rtag tu 'dzum par byed //
translated: The steadfast always smile.

original: ji ltar ngag gis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ngag gis she na /
translated: How are they unequaled in verbal knowledge of the world?

original: bshad pa / gsong po dag tu smra ba yin //
analyzed: bshad pa / gsong po dag tu smra ba yin //
translated: They speak pleasantly.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: bshad pa / sems can snod du bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / sems can snod du bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: In order to make sentient beings into🔽receptacles.

original: don gang gi ched du sems can snod du bya zhe na /
analyzed: don gang gi ched du sems can snod du bya zhe na /
translated: For what purpose are sentient beings made into receptacles?

original: bshad pa / dam chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //🔽ji ltar bden pa shes pas zhe na /
analyzed: bshad pa / dam chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir // ji ltar bden pa shes pas zhe na /
translated: In order to practice the holy Dharma.

original: bshad pa / gang phyir bden pa gnyis las ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang phyir bden pa gnyis las ni //
translated: How is it that the world is known through knowing the truths?

original: 'jig rten rnam dag 'byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam dag 'byung bar 'dod //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Because the world is held to arise

original: gnyis kyis nub 'gyur de yi phyir //
analyzed: gnyis kyis nub 'gyur de yi phyir //
translated: and disappear through the two truths.🔽The world disappears through the two.

original: de shes 'jig rten shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de shes 'jig rten shes zhes bya //
translated: Therefore, knowing them is called knowing the world.

original: bden ba gnyis kyis ni 'jig rten 'khor bar yang dang yang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: bden ba gnyis kyis ni 'jig rten 'khor bar yang dang yang du 'byung ste /
translated: The world arises again and again in saṃsāra through the two truths,

original: gang dang gang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of what and through what it arises.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis kyis ni nub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis kyis ni nub par 'gyur te /
translated: The world disappears through the two truths of cessation and the path,

original: gang yin pa dang / gang gis nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yin pa dang / gang gis nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of what and through what it disappears.

original: de lta bas na de shes pa ni 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de shes pa ni 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, knowing them is called knowing the world,

original: 'jig rten 'byung ba dang nub par 'gyur ba shes pa rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'byung ba dang nub par 'gyur ba shes pa rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the knowledge of the arising and disappearance of the world.

original: de dag zhi bya thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag zhi bya thob bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to pacify and to attain those,

original: blo ldan bden pa rnams la sbyor //
analyzed: blo ldan bden pa rnams la sbyor //
translated: the wise apply themselves to the truths.

original: gang gis blo ldan bden shes phyir //
analyzed: gang gis blo ldan bden shes phyir //
translated: Because the wise know the truths,

original: 'jig rten shes zhes nges par brjod //
analyzed: 'jig rten shes zhes nges par brjod //
translated: they are called knowers of the world.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten shes pa nyid kyi las bstan te //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten shes pa nyid kyi las bstan te //
translated: This shows the activity of the knowledge of the world.

original: de la zhi bar bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag go //
analyzed: de la zhi bar bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag go //
translated: The pacification of suffering and the origin of suffering is to be attained.

original: thob par bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag go //
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag go //
translated: The cessation of suffering and the path are to be attained.

original: ston pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ston pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Three verses on the analysis of teachers:

original: gtsug lag bstan pa'i chos dang ni //
analyzed: gtsug lag bstan pa'i chos dang ni //
translated: The teaching Dharma is the canon;

original: de don dgongs pa can dang ni //
analyzed: de don dgongs pa can dang ni //
translated: the meaning is the interpretable meaning;🔽the authority is the definitive meaning;

original: nges don tshad ma ldan pa dang // de yi brjod med thob pa'o //
analyzed: nges don tshad ma ldan pa dang // de yi brjod med thob pa'o //
translated: and the attainment is the inexpressible.

original: 'di ni ston pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //🔽de la tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don ni ston pa tshad mar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do // de la tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don ni ston pa tshad mar gyur pa'am /
translated: This is the definition of teachers.🔽The meaning of the canon is the interpretable meaning.

original: des tshad mar mdzad pas nges par byas shing rnam par phye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: des tshad mar mdzad pas nges par byas shing rnam par phye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The definitive meaning is the authority, that is, that which is ascertained and analyzed by the teacher who is an authority or by one authorized by him.

original: brjod pa med pa thob pa ni rtogs pa'i ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa med pa thob pa ni rtogs pa'i ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The attainment of the inexpressible is the supramundane intuition of realization.

original: de ni brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is inexpressible.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: spong dang ji skad @224a * //
analyzed: spong dang ji skad @224a * //
translated: Abandonment, as it is explained,🔽false understanding,🔽attainment with verbal expression,

original: bshad pa dang // log par yang dag shes pa dang // brjod dang bcas pa 'thob pa dang // 'dir ni dgag par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: bshad pa dang // log par yang dag shes pa dang // brjod dang bcas pa 'thob pa dang // 'dir ni dgag par bstan pa yin //
translated: and here, what is taught as negation.

original: ston pa dang po la ni gtsug lag gi chos spong ba'i gang zag dgag par bstan to //
analyzed: ston pa dang po la ni gtsug lag gi chos spong ba'i gang zag dgag par bstan to //
translated: In the first teaching, the individual who abandons the Dharma of scripture is taught as being negated.

original: gnyis pa la ni tshig 'bru sgra ji bzhin gyi don te dgongs pa can gyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni tshig 'bru sgra ji bzhin gyi don te dgongs pa can gyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: In the second, the meaning is literal, not the intended meaning.

original: gsum pa la ni log par bsams pa'i don phyin ci log tu drangs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni log par bsams pa'i don phyin ci log tu drangs pa'o //
translated: In the third, the meaning of false reflection is drawn out in error.

original: bzhi pa la ni brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: In the fourth, verbal expression is not the self experienced object of individual knowledge.

original: mos dang rnam par dpyod pa dang // gzhan las ji bzhin thos pa dang // brjod pa med pa'i ye shes las ;🔽/ brtan rnams nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos dang rnam par dpyod pa dang // gzhan las ji bzhin thos pa dang // brjod pa med pa'i ye shes las ; / brtan rnams nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and through nonconceptual intuition.

original: 'di ni ston pa'i phan yon yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i phan yon yin te /
translated: This shows the benefits of teaching.

original: ston pa dang pos ni gtsug lag gi chos la mos pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston pa dang pos ni gtsug lag gi chos la mos pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the first, one does not lose faith in the teachings of the scriptures.

original: gnyis pas ni bdag nyid kyi dgongs pa can gyi don dpyod pa las so //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni bdag nyid kyi dgongs pa can gyi don dpyod pa las so //
translated: Through the second, one does not lose the analysis of the meaning of the scriptures.

original: gsum pas ni gzhan las de'i don gyi tshul phyin ci ma log par thos pa las so //
analyzed: gsum pas ni gzhan las de'i don gyi tshul phyin ci ma log par thos pa las so //
translated: Through the third, one does not lose the unadorned meaning of the scriptures as it is heard from others.

original: bzhi pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes las so //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes las so //
translated: Through the fourth, one does not lose supramundane intuition.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste //
translated: Four verses on the analysis of the correct knowledges.🔽1. The bodhisattvas' four correct knowledges🔽are considered to be unequalled,🔽because of synonyms, characteristics,

original: rnam grangs dang ni mtshan nyid dang // tshig dang ye shes shes pa'i phyir //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag rig / bzhi bo mtshungs pa med par 'dod //
analyzed: rnam grangs dang ni mtshan nyid dang // tshig dang ye shes shes pa'i phyir //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag rig / bzhi bo mtshungs pa med par 'dod //
translated: words, and knowledge.

original: dang po ni rnam grangs shes pa de //
analyzed: dang po ni rnam grangs shes pa de //
translated: The first is the knowledge of the categories.

original: don re re'i ming gi rnam grangs ji snyed shes pa yin no //
analyzed: don re re'i ming gi rnam grangs ji snyed shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge of the synonyms of each meaning.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid shes pa ste /
translated: The second is the knowledge of the characteristics.

original: don gang yin pa de'i ming shes pa yin no //
analyzed: don gang yin pa de'i ming shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge of the name of each meaning.

original: gsum pa ni tshig shes pa ste //
analyzed: gsum pa ni tshig shes pa ste //
translated: The third is the knowledge of the words.

original: yul mi so so'i skad gang dag yin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul mi so so'i skad gang dag yin pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the languages of each country.

original: bzhi pa ni ye shes shes pa ste //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni ye shes shes pa ste //
translated: The fourth is the knowledge of wisdom.

original: bdag nyid kyi spobs pa gang yin pa ste //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi spobs pa gang yin pa ste //
translated: It is one's own eloquence.

original: 'di ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin no //🔽bstan pa la ni rab brtson pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin no // bstan pa la ni rab brtson pa'i //
translated: This is the definition of the correct understandings.🔽Those who are diligent in teaching

original: gang dang gang gis ston pa ni //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis ston pa ni //
translated: teach with whatever is appropriate.🔽They teach the two, the teaching and the meaning,

original: chos dang don ni gnyis po dag / tshig dang shes pa kho nas ston //
analyzed: chos dang don ni gnyis po dag / tshig dang shes pa kho nas ston //
translated: only through words and knowledge.🔽The teaching is for teaching and explaining,

original: chos ni bstan dang bshad phyir dang // rnam pa kun du gnyis thob phyir //
analyzed: chos ni bstan dang bshad phyir dang // rnam pa kun du gnyis thob phyir //
translated: for obtaining the two in every way,

original: rgol ba rnams kyi lan 'debs phyir //
analyzed: rgol ba rnams kyi lan 'debs phyir //
translated: and for answering the objections of opponents.

original: so so yang dag rig pa bzhi //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig pa bzhi //
translated: These are the four correct understandings.

original: zhes bya ba ni bzhi nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzhi nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: This is the reason for the fourfold division.

original: bstan pa la rab tu brtson pa'i gang zhig gang gis ston pa de la ye shes @224b dgos so //
analyzed: bstan pa la rab tu brtson pa'i gang zhig gang gis ston pa de la ye shes @224b dgos so //
translated: One who is intent on teaching must have knowledge of what is to be taught, the means of teaching, and the purpose of teaching.

original: gang zhig ston ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ston ce na /
translated: What is to be taught?

original: chos dang don no //
analyzed: chos dang don no //
translated: The teaching and its import.

original: gang gis ston ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ston ce na /
translated: By what means is it taught?

original: tshig gi shes pas so //
analyzed: tshig gi shes pas so //
translated: By speech and knowledge.

original: de la chos dang don dag ston pa ni chos bstan pa dang bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos dang don dag ston pa ni chos bstan pa dang bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching and its import are taught by means of the teaching and explanation of the teaching.

original: tshig gis ston pa ni gnyis po de nyid rnam pa thams cad du thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gis ston pa ni gnyis po de nyid rnam pa thams cad du thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech teaches by means of the expression of the teaching and its import in every way.

original: shes pas ston pa ni rgol ba rnams kyi lan 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pas ston pa ni rgol ba rnams kyi lan 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge teaches by means of the reply to the objections of adversaries.

original: de bas na gang zhig gang gis ston pa de shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig gang gis ston pa de shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of the knowledge of what is to be taught and the means of teaching,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the four right discriminations are established.

original: mnyam nyid so so rang rig nas //
analyzed: mnyam nyid so so rang rig nas //
translated: Having realized the equality of self and other,

original: phyis ni rab tu shes pa yin //
analyzed: phyis ni rab tu shes pa yin //
translated: one later comes to know.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod byed pa //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod byed pa //
translated: The cutting off of all doubts

original: so so yang dag rig par brjod //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig par brjod //
translated: is called the right discrimination.

original: 'dis ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dang las bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dang las bstan te /
translated: This shows the verbal expression and function of the analytical knowledges.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de bzhin nyid so so rang gis rig nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de bzhin nyid so so rang gis rig nas /
translated: Having realized by supramundane knowledge the reality of the sameness of all things,

original: dus phyis de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas rnam grangs la sogs pa rab tu shes pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dus phyis de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas rnam grangs la sogs pa rab tu shes pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: later, by the knowledge that is attained subsequently, one knows the categories, etc. This is the verbal expression of the analytical knowledges.

original: gzhan dag gi the tshom thams cad gcod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni las yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi the tshom thams cad gcod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni las yin no //
translated: The function is to eliminate all the doubts of others.

original: tshogs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs //
analyzed: tshogs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa bzhi ste / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs //
translated: Four verses on the analysis of the stores🔽The stores of merit and wisdom of the bodhisattvas

original: bsod nams ye shes mtshungs pa med //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes mtshungs pa med //
translated: are unequalled,

original: gcig gis 'khor bar mngon mtho byed //
analyzed: gcig gis 'khor bar mngon mtho byed //
translated: One causes high rebirth in cyclic existence,

original: gzhan gyis nyon mongs med par 'khor //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyon mongs med par 'khor //
translated: the other causes the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: 'dis ni tshogs gang yin pa dang gang gi don du yin pa de bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshogs gang yin pa dang gang gi don du yin pa de bstan to //
translated: This shows what the stores are and what their purpose is.

original: tshogs ni rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: tshogs ni rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: The accumulations are of two kinds:

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of knowledge.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis ni 'khor ba na mngon par mtho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis ni 'khor ba na mngon par mtho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the accumulation of merit, one attains high status in cyclic existence.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the accumulation of knowledge, one attains the non-afflicted state in cyclic existence.

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bsod nams kyi //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bsod nams kyi //
translated: Giving and morality are the accumulation of merit;

original: tshogs yin shes rab ye shes kyi //
analyzed: tshogs yin shes rab ye shes kyi //
translated: wisdom is the accumulation of knowledge.

original: gsum po gzhan ni gnyis ka ste /
analyzed: gsum po gzhan ni gnyis ka ste /
translated: The other three are both;

original: lnga char yang ni ye shes tshogs ;
analyzed: lnga char yang ni ye shes tshogs ;
translated: all five are the accumulation of knowledge.

original: /'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis tshogs gnyis po de bsdus par ston te /
analyzed: /'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis tshogs gnyis po de bsdus par ston te /
translated: This shows that the two accumulations are included in the perfections.

original: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis ni gnyi ga byed do //
analyzed: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis ni gnyi ga byed do //
translated: By the power of patience, effort, and meditation, one does both.

original: de lta bas na gsum po ni tshogs gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsum po ni tshogs gnyi ga yin no //
translated: Therefore, the three are both accumulations.

original: yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po thams cad shes @225a * //
analyzed: yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po thams cad shes @225a * //
translated: Moreover, all five perfections are the accumulation of knowledge.

original: rab tu yongs su bsngos pa'i sgo nas ye shes kyi tshogs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu yongs su bsngos pa'i sgo nas ye shes kyi tshogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The collection of wisdom should be understood as the thoroughly transformed collection.

original: rgyun du sgom pa thob nas ni //
analyzed: rgyun du sgom pa thob nas ni //
translated: Having attained continuous meditation,

original: dge la yang dang yang du sgrub //
analyzed: dge la yang dang yang du sgrub //
translated: the steadfast one accomplishes virtue again and again.

original: brtan pa'i tshogs gang yin pa de //
analyzed: brtan pa'i tshogs gang yin pa de //
translated: The collection of the steadfast

original: don kun sgrub par byed pa yin //
analyzed: don kun sgrub par byed pa yin //
translated: accomplishes all aims.

original: 'di ni tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig dang las yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig dang las yin te //
translated: This is the etymology and function of the collections.

original: sam zhes bya ba ni rgyun du'o //
analyzed: sam zhes bya ba ni rgyun du'o //
translated: Sam means continuous.

original: bha zhes bya ba ni sgom pa thob nas so //
analyzed: bha zhes bya ba ni sgom pa thob nas so //
translated: Bha means having attained meditation.

original: ra zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ra zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du sgrub pa'o //
translated: Ra means accomplishing again and again.

original: don thams cad sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni las te /
analyzed: don thams cad sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni las te /
translated: Accomplishing all aims is the function,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don dag sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don dag sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accomplishes one’s own and others’ aims.🔽The steadfast accomplish the collections🔽in order to engage, in order to have no sign,🔽in order to be spontaneous,

original: 'jug dang mtshan ma med pa dang // lhun gyis grub par bya ba dang // dbang bskur mthar thug bya ba'i phyir //🔽brtan rnams tshogs ni sgrub par byed //
analyzed: 'jug dang mtshan ma med pa dang // lhun gyis grub par bya ba dang // dbang bskur mthar thug bya ba'i phyir // brtan rnams tshogs ni sgrub par byed //
translated: in order to be consecrated, and in order to reach the end.

original: 'di ni tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: This is the analysis of the collections.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i tshogs ni sa la 'jug pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i tshogs ni sa la 'jug pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: The accumulation of the stage of devoted conduct is for the purpose of entering the stages.

original: sa drug po dag gi ni mtshan ma med pas bdun pas bsdus pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: sa drug po dag gi ni mtshan ma med pas bdun pas bsdus pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: The accumulation of the six stages is for the purpose of the seventh stage, because it is included in the stage of direct intuition devoid of signs.

original: de na mtshan ma kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de na mtshan ma kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: For, on that stage, one does not engage in the process of signs.

original: / sa brgyad pa'i ni lhun gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: / sa brgyad pa'i ni lhun gyis grub pa ste /
translated: The accumulation of the eighth stage is spontaneous,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sa gnyis bsdus pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sa gnyis bsdus pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: because it is included in the other two stages.

original: de gnyis kyi tshogs ni dbang bskur ba'i ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi tshogs ni dbang bskur ba'i ste /
translated: The accumulation of those two is the coronation,

original: sa bcu pas bsdus pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu pas bsdus pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: because it is included in the tenth stage.

original: de'i tshogs ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshogs ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The accumulation of that is the ultimate,

original: sangs rgyas kyis sa bsdus pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis sa bsdus pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: because it is included in the stage of Buddhahood.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gsum ste //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gsum ste //
translated: Three verses on the analysis of the applications of mindfulness.

original: blo ldan dran pa nyer gzhag pa //
analyzed: blo ldan dran pa nyer gzhag pa //
translated: The wise cultivate the applications of mindfulness

original: sgom pa rnam pa bcu bzhi yis //
analyzed: sgom pa rnam pa bcu bzhi yis //
translated: in fourteen different ways.

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir na de //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir na de //
translated: They are unequalled,

original: de las gzhan las khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: de las gzhan las khyad par 'phags //
translated: and so they are superior to the others.

original: bcu bzhi po gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: bcu bzhi po gang dag gis she na /
translated: By what fourteen?🔽They are superior by support,

original: brten dang gnyen po dag dang ni ;
analyzed: brten dang gnyen po dag dang ni ;
translated: antidote,🔽engagement,🔽object, mental activity,🔽and hearing,🔽by concordance,

original: / de bzhin du ni 'jug pa dang // dmigs pa dang ni yid byed dang // thos pas sgom pa khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: / de bzhin du ni 'jug pa dang // dmigs pa dang ni yid byed dang // thos pas sgom pa khyad par 'phags //
translated: by engagement,🔽by full understanding,🔽by birth,🔽by greatness,🔽by supremacy,🔽by meditation,

original: mthun dang rjes su 'jug pa dang // yongs su shes dang skye ba dang // chen po dang ni mchog nyid dang // bsgom dang yang dag 'grub pas gzhan //
analyzed: mthun dang rjes su 'jug pa dang // yongs su shes dang skye ba dang // chen po dang ni mchog nyid dang // bsgom dang yang dag 'grub pas gzhan //
translated: and by true accomplishment.

original: zhes bya ba rnam pa bcu bzhi po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam pa bcu bzhi po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ practice of the close mindfulness is superior by these fourteen aspects.

original: rten gyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rten gyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it superior by support?

original: theg pa chen po thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brten nas so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brten nas so //
translated: It is supported by the wisdom that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation on the Great Vehicle.

original: gnyen pos ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen pos ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it superior by antidote?

original: lus @225b la sogs pa'i chos la bdag med par 'jug pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes rnams kyi yang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus @225b la sogs pa'i chos la bdag med par 'jug pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes rnams kyi yang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also antidotes to the four errors, since they engage the selflessness of the body, etc. They are also antidotes to the notions of purity, happiness, permanence, and self, since they engage the body, etc. as impure, suffering, impermanent, and selfless.

original: 'jug pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they engaged?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis go rims bzhin du bdag nyid kyang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la 'jug cing gzhan dag kyang 'dzud pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis go rims bzhin du bdag nyid kyang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la 'jug cing gzhan dag kyang 'dzud pa'i phyir te /
translated: They engage the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, respectively, and they cause others to engage them, since they are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: This is as explained in the Madhyantavibhāga.

original: dmigs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they objective supports?

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are objective supports for all sentient beings’ bodies, etc.

original: yid la byed pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they mental attentions?

original: lus la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are mental attentions that do not objectify the body, etc.

original: thob pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: thob pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they attainments?

original: lus la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: Nor is it for the sake of either being separated from the body, etc.,

original: mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: or not being separated from them.

original: mthun pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mthun pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it in conformity?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the antidote to the resistances to the perfections.

original: rjes su 'jug pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it in accord?

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang rjes su 'jug pas de dag la de bstan pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang rjes su 'jug pas de dag la de bstan pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in accord with the mundane, the disciples, and the hermit buddhas, because it is taught to them in order that they may cultivate the close mindfulness that is endowed with those perfections.

original: yongs su shes pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it in thorough knowledge?

original: lus ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid du yongs su shes pas te /
analyzed: lus ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid du yongs su shes pas te /
translated: The body is thoroughly known as being like an illusion,

original: de kho na bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as an unreal nature just like an illusion.

original: tshor ba ni rmi lam lta bu nyid du yongs su shes pas te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni rmi lam lta bu nyid du yongs su shes pas te /
translated: Sensation is thoroughly known as being like a dream,🔽because it is experienced only for a short time, like something seen in a dream.

original: de kho na bzhin du log par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du log par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they experience it in the same way as a false experience.

original: sems ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: sems ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar yongs su shes pas so //
translated: The mind is like space, because it is completely known to be naturally luminous.

original: chos rnams ni nam mkha' glo bur gyi rdul dang du ba dang sprin dang khug rnas khebs pa bzhin du glo bur ba nyid du yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: chos rnams ni nam mkha' glo bur gyi rdul dang du ba dang sprin dang khug rnas khebs pa bzhin du glo bur ba nyid du yongs su shes pas so //
translated: Dharmas are like space, because they are completely known to be adventitious, like the adventitious obscurations of dust, smoke, clouds, and fog.

original: skye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: skye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by birth?

original: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba na 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs par gyur ba'i lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa phun sum tshogs shing de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas so //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba na 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs par gyur ba'i lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa phun sum tshogs shing de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas so //
translated: When one is born in existence as one wishes, one has a body and feelings, etc. that are excellent, like a universal monarch, etc. and one is not defiled by them.

original: chen pos ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chen pos ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by greatness?

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba nyid kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa chung du yang de las gzhan pa dag las che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba nyid kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa chung du yang de las gzhan pa dag las che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even the lesser cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is greater than that of others, because one is naturally sharp-witted.

original: mchog nyid kyis ji lta bu zhes @226a * //
analyzed: mchog nyid kyis ji lta bu zhes @226a * //
translated: How is it by supremacy?

original: na ; bsgom pa yongs su grub pa rnams 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa lhun gyis grub par bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na ; bsgom pa yongs su grub pa rnams 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa lhun gyis grub par bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the perfection of meditation, because they meditate on the thoroughly established reality, which is the union of the perfected and the purified, spontaneously and effortlessly.

original: bsgoms pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by cultivation?

original: shin tu bsgoms pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bsgoms pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of very thorough cultivation, it is not exhausted even in the nirvana without remainder.

original: yang dag par 'grub pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by perfect accomplishment?

original: sa bcu dang sangs rgyas kyis nyid du yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu dang sangs rgyas kyis nyid du yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is perfectly accomplished in the ten stages and in Buddhahood.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
translated: Five verses on the analysis of the correct exertions

original: brtan pa rnams kyi yang dag spong //
analyzed: brtan pa rnams kyi yang dag spong //
translated: The correct exertions of the steadfast

original: lus can kun dang mtshungs pa med //🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yi //
analyzed: lus can kun dang mtshungs pa med // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yi //
translated: are unrivaled by any others.🔽They are cultivated as the remedies

original: nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por sgom //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por sgom //
translated: for the faults in the applications of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ji skad bshad pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ji skad bshad pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The cultivation of the correct exertions is the antidote to the faults which are the opposites of the previously explained cultivation of the close mindfulnesses. This is the general characteristic of the correct exertions.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: Their differentiation is:🔽For the enjoyment of cyclic existence,🔽for the casting off of obscurations,🔽for the casting off of attentions,🔽for the entry into the stages,🔽for the abiding in signlessness,🔽for the attainment of prophecy,

original: 'khor ba nye bar spyad pa dang // sgrib pa dag ni dor ba dang // yid la byed pa dor ba dang // sa rnams la ni 'jug pa dang // mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang // lung bstan pa ni thob pa dang // sems can rnams yongs smin bya dang //
analyzed: 'khor ba nye bar spyad pa dang // sgrib pa dag ni dor ba dang // yid la byed pa dor ba dang // sa rnams la ni 'jug pa dang // mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang // lung bstan pa ni thob pa dang // sems can rnams yongs smin bya dang //
translated: for the full maturation of sentient beings,🔽for the consecration of the fields,

original: dbang ni bskur bar bya ba dang // zhing rnams dag par bya phyir dang // mthar thug nyid du bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang ni bskur bar bya ba dang // zhing rnams dag par bya phyir dang // mthar thug nyid du bya ba'i phyir //
translated: and for the ultimate,

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan rnams //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan rnams //
translated: the wise bodhisattvas

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen por sgom //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen por sgom //
translated: cultivate the antidotes to the opposing factors.

original: 'di ni yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba ste //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba ste //
translated: This is the differentiation of the cultivation of the correct exertions.

original: 'khor ba'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par yongs su longs spyod pa dang / sgrib pa lnga dor ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa dor ba dang / sa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par yongs su longs spyod pa dang / sgrib pa lnga dor ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa dor ba dang / sa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to enjoy the abundance of cyclic existence without being defiled by it. It is to abandon the five hindrances, to abandon the attitudes of the disciples and the solitary sages, and to enter the stages.

original: sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang / sa brgyad pa la lung bstan pa thob pa dang / dgu pa la sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bcu pa la dbang bskur ba dang / gsum car la zhing rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang / sa brgyad pa la lung bstan pa thob pa dang / dgu pa la sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bcu pa la dbang bskur ba dang / gsum car la zhing rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: It is to abide in the absence of attributes on the seventh stage, to obtain the prediction on the eighth stage, to bring sentient beings to full maturity on the ninth stage, to receive consecration on the tenth stage, and to purify the field on all three stages.

original: sangs rgyas kyis la mthar thug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis la mthar thug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And it is to reach the culmination of the stages of the Buddhas.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang dag yin pa de dag gi gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang dag yin pa de dag gi gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the cultivation of the correct exertions is the antidote to those unfavorable factors.

original: 'di ni de'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the correct exertions.

original: 'dun pa la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: 'dun pa la ni brten nas su //
translated: With regard to the correct exertions,

original: rnal 'byor rgyu mtshan bcas bsgom @226b pa ;
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyu mtshan bcas bsgom @226b pa ;
translated: The cultivation of yoga and the signs is

original: / yang dag spong ba thams cad la //
analyzed: / yang dag spong ba thams cad la //
translated: all the correct exertions.

analyzed: gsum pa gtod par byed pa ste //

analyzed: dang cing don du gnyer na 'bad pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Thought and equanimity are the means of antidote because they are antidotes to the secondary mental afflictions of lethargy and excitement and to the mental afflictions.

original: mngon par sgrub pa rnam pa drug gang zhe na /

translated: They have great wealth, because they have the five eyes: the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.

original: gdams ngag ni mngon par shes pa drug ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag ni mngon par shes pa drug ste /
translated: They have great courage, because they have the six superknowledges.

original: de dag gis go rims bzhin du nye bar song nas skad dang sems dang 'ong ba dang 'gro ba rig par byas nas nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir 'doms pa'i phyir ro //

original: gnas pas rnam par rtse ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pas rnam par rtse ba ni /

analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ting nge 'dzin gyis sprul pa la sogs pa rnam pa du mas rnam par rtse ba yin no //
translated: They have great courage, because they have the six superknowledges.🔽Having gone to the sentient beings by means of the superknowledge of magical powers, having known their language by means of the superknowledge of the divine eye, and having known their thoughts by means of the superknowledge of the knowledge of others' minds, they teach the Dharma by means of the superknowledge of the knowledge of former abodes and the superknowledge of the termination of contaminations, in order to liberate them.🔽They have great gratitude, because they have the four controlling powers.

analyzed: smon lam ni smon lam shes pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs can rnams smon lam khyad par can gyis rnam par rtse ba'o //

original: de dag gi lus dang 'od dang dbyangs ni bgrang bar sla ba ma yin te /

analyzed: dbang bcu ji skad bstan pa lta bu yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni mthong ba la sogs pa mngon par sgrub pa rnam pa drug yin no //

translated: through concentration.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'byor pa khyim bdag rin po che las grub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'byor pa khyim bdag rin po che las grub pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the wealth of the universal monarch is accomplished from the precious householder.

original: btang snyoms kyis ni thams cad du //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis ni thams cad du //
translated: Through equanimity,

original: 'di ni ji ltar 'dod bzhin gnas //🔽rjes la thob dang mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ni ji ltar 'dod bzhin gnas // rjes la thob dang mi rtog pa'i //
translated: one always abides as one wishes.

original: gnas pas mchog ni rtag tu gnas //
analyzed: gnas pas mchog ni rtag tu gnas //
translated: One always abides in the highest🔽through subsequent attainment and nonconceptual states.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Equanimity is nonconceptual gnosis.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gnas te /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gnas te /
translated: By means of that, bodhisattvas remain wherever they wish.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa'i gnas pas gzhan 'bul zhing gzhan 'dor ba'i phyir dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas pas de la rtsol pa med par gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i gnas pas gzhan 'bul zhing gzhan 'dor ba'i phyir dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas pas de la rtsol pa med par gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because, by means of the postmeditational activities, they can give up one place and go to another and, by means of nonconceptual meditative equipoise, they can remain in that state effortlessly.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i blon po rin po che dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa dbul bar bya ba yang 'bul la /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i blon po rin po che dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa dbul bar bya ba yang 'bul la /
translated: To give an analogy, the precious minister of a universal emperor can give away the four divisions of the army and can also take them back.

original: dor bar bya ba yang 'dor zhing gang du dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ma dub par phyin pa der song nas kyang gnas par byed do ;
analyzed: dor bar bya ba yang 'dor zhing gang du dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ma dub par phyin pa der song nas kyang gnas par byed do ;
translated: And wherever the four divisions of the army go without getting tired, he goes there too and stays.

original: / yon tan de lta'i sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: / yon tan de lta'i sems dpa' ni //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have such qualities

original: 'khor los sgyur ba 'dra bar 'jug / yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang 'dra bar 'jug go //🔽rtag tu rin chen bdun lta bu'i //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba 'dra bar 'jug / yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang 'dra bar 'jug go // rtag tu rin chen bdun lta bu'i //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses such qualities enters like a universal monarch.

original: byang chub yan lag rnams kyis bskor //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag rnams kyis bskor //
translated: The branches of enlightenment are always surrounded by the seven jewels.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rin po che dang 'dra ba nyid du mjug sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rin po che dang 'dra ba nyid du mjug sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: This verse summarizes the analogy between the branches of enlightenment and the jewels.

original: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
translated: The branch of origination, the branch of nature, the third is the branch of renunciation,

original: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag yin //
analyzed: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag yin //
translated: the fourth is the branch of benefit.

original: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag /'dis ni byang chub kyi yan lag @228b gang yin pa dang / ji ltar yan lag yin pa de ston to //
analyzed: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag /'dis ni byang chub kyi yan lag @228b gang yin pa dang / ji ltar yan lag yin pa de ston to //
translated: The branch of non-affliction is threefold. This shows what the branches of enlightenment are and how they are branches.

original: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ste /
translated: Among them, mindfulness is the branch of origination,

original: thams cad de la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the others arise in dependence on it.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
translated: The investigation of phenomena is the branch of nature,🔽because it is the nature of enlightenment.

original: byang chub ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: enlightenment is its essence.

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Exertion is the limb of release,

original: des mthar thug pa ma thob kyi bar du rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mthar thug pa ma thob kyi bar du rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by it one does not interrupt the process until one reaches the end.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste //
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste //
translated: Joy is the limb of benefit,

original: des sems dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it makes the mind joyful.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Serenity, concentration, and equanimity are the limbs of nondefilement.

original: gang gis gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of nondefilement should be understood as the limbs of nondefilement: that by which there is nondefilement, that in which there is nondefilement, and that in virtue of which there is nondefilement.

original: lam gyi yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the limbs of the path.🔽After that, the path of insight

original: de yi 'og tu ji lta bar //🔽rtogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu ji lta bar // rtogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ste //
translated: is to be understood as having the same number of limbs.

original: rnam gzhag ji bzhin rtogs pa yang //
analyzed: rnam gzhag ji bzhin rtogs pa yang //
translated: The path of cultivation is to be understood as having the same number of limbs as the path of insight.

original: rnam par gzhag la 'jug pa dang // las gsum rnam par dag pa dang // shes bya dag dang lam dang ni //🔽yon tan khyad par can gyi ni //🔽sgrib pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //🔽byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag la 'jug pa dang // las gsum rnam par dag pa dang // shes bya dag dang lam dang ni // yon tan khyad par can gyi ni // sgrib pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o // byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //

original: rtogs pa de nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa yongs su dpyod pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //🔽de rnam par gzhag pa mdo'i sde la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la 'jug pa yang de nyid yin te /🔽des de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽las gsum rnam par dag pa ni /🔽yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ste /🔽ngag dang lus dang gnyi ga'i las bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa de nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa yongs su dpyod pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //🔽de rnam par gzhag pa mdo'i sde la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la 'jug pa yang de nyid yin te /🔽des de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽las gsum rnam par dag pa ni /🔽yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ste /🔽ngag dang lus dang gnyi ga'i las bsdus pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol pa la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa dang / yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol pa la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa dang / yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom pa ste /
translated: Right effort and so on are the cultivation of the antidotes to the obscurations to omniscience, the obscurations of action, and the obscurations to the special qualities, respectively.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas ni yun ring por mi skyo bar shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom par byed do //🔽yang dag pa'i dran pas ni zhi gnas dang rab @229a * //🔽tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan dag la zhum pa dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas ni yun ring por mi skyo bar shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom par byed do // yang dag pa'i dran pas ni zhi gnas dang rab @229a * // tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan dag la zhum pa dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: By right effort, one cultivates the antidotes to the obscurations to omniscience without becoming discouraged for a long time.

original: lam mngon sum du bya ba'i ched du sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom par byed do //
analyzed: lam mngon sum du bya ba'i ched du sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom par byed do //
translated: By right mindfulness, one cultivates the antidotes to the obscurations to the direct realization of the path because one is without either laxity or excitement with regard to the signs of meditative serenity and insight.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po sgom par byed do //
translated: By right concentration, one cultivates the antidotes to the obscurations to the special qualities.

original: de ltar na lam gyi yan lag rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na lam gyi yan lag rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the path is established as having eight members.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /🔽yang dag gnas pa la brten nas //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste / yang dag gnas pa la brten nas //
translated: Three verses on the analysis of serenity and insight.🔽Because the mind is set on the mind,

original: sems la sems ni 'jog phyir dang // chos rab rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems la sems ni 'jog phyir dang // chos rab rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir //
translated: and because phenomena are fully discerned,

original: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong yin //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong yin //
translated: there is serenity and insight.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas sems la sems nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas sems la sems nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind is set on the mind by means of right concentration, and because phenomena are fully discerned, there is serenity and insight.

original: go rims bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'i ting nge 'dzin med par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'i ting nge 'dzin med par ni ma yin te /
translated: One should know that serenity and insight are not without concentration.

original: 'di ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the definition of serenity and insight.🔽It is considered universal, partial,

original: de ni kun 'gro cha gcig dang // cha gcig ma yin rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni kun 'gro cha gcig dang // cha gcig ma yin rgyur 'dod do //
translated: and nonpartial, and a cause.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni yon tan gang dang gang 'dod pa de dang de bsgom pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni yon tan gang dang gang 'dod pa de dang de bsgom pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba yin te /
translated: Serenity and insight are universal, because they are the cultivation of whatever virtues one wishes.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a scripture declares,

original: dge slong kye ma bdag gis 'dod pa dag las dben par 'dod na zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dge slong des chos gnyis po 'di kho na bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong kye ma bdag gis 'dod pa dag las dben par 'dod na zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dge slong des chos gnyis po 'di kho na bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The monk thinks, “Alas, I wish to be free from desire. ”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The monk should cultivate only these two things:

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha gcig pa ni gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha gcig pa ni gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Śamatha and vipaśyanā are practiced separately when one cultivates śamatha and vipaśyanā separately.

original: gnyis ka'i cha ni gang tshe cig car gnyi ga sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i cha ni gang tshe cig car gnyi ga sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: They are practiced together when one cultivates them together.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rgyu yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rgyu yin par 'dod do //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ śamatha and vipaśyanā are asserted to be the cause of the stage of action out of faith.🔽Realization, definite emergence,🔽signlessness, non-application,

original: rtogs dang nges par 'byung ba dang // mtshan med 'du mi byed pa dang // yongs dag rnam par dag pa la //
analyzed: rtogs dang nges par 'byung ba dang // mtshan med 'du mi byed pa dang // yongs dag rnam par dag pa la //
translated: purification, and complete purification🔽are the five kinds of vipaśyanā.

original: brtan pa'i zhi gnas lhag mthong gis //
analyzed: brtan pa'i zhi gnas lhag mthong gis //
translated: The steadfast ones’ śamatha and vipaśyanā

original: rnal 'byor de sa kun 'gro ste //
analyzed: rnal 'byor de sa kun 'gro ste //
translated: are the yoga that is the basis of all the grounds.

original: thams cad sgrub par byed pa yin //
analyzed: thams cad sgrub par byed pa yin //
translated: It accomplishes everything.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyur 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhi gnas @229b dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye ba dang las bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyur 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhi gnas @229b dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye ba dang las bstan pa yin te /
translated: The statement “The cause is asserted to be…” and so on teaches the divisions of serenity and insight and their functions.

original: rnal 'byor ni thabs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni thabs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Yoga should be understood as the method.

original: de la rtogs pa ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Realization is the entry to the first stage.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni sa drug pa'i bar te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni sa drug pa'i bar te /
translated: Departure is up to the sixth stage,

original: de dag gi mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one departs from the preparatory practice that is accompanied by signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni sa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni sa bdun pa'o //
translated: Signlessness is the seventh stage.

original: 'du mi byed pa ni sa gzhan gsum ste /
analyzed: 'du mi byed pa ni sa gzhan gsum ste /
translated: Non-performance is the other three stages,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they occur without manifest activity.

original: 'du bya ba ni 'du byed pa ste //
analyzed: 'du bya ba ni 'du byed pa ste //
translated: Performance is activity.

original: de 'di la med pas 'du byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la med pas 'du byed pa med pa'o //
translated: Since that is absent here, there is no performance.

original: sa gsum po de nyid la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su sbyang bar bya la ;
analyzed: sa gsum po de nyid la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su sbyang bar bya la ;
translated: Also, on the basis of those three stages, the buddha land is purified.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyang thob par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyang thob par bya ste /
translated: One should also attain buddhahood.

original: 'di ni go rims bzhin du yongs su dag pa dang // rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni go rims bzhin du yongs su dag pa dang // rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: These are, respectively, the thoroughly pure and the pure.

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of skill in means

original: sangs rgyas chos rnams rdzogs bya dang / sems can rnams yengs smin bya dang // myur thob bya ba 'grub pa dang // lam rgyun mi gcod la mkhas pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams rdzogs bya dang / sems can rnams yengs smin bya dang // myur thob bya ba 'grub pa dang // lam rgyun mi gcod la mkhas pa //
translated: In order to perfect the buddha-qualities, to develop living beings, to quickly attain the goal, and to not abandon the lifecycle,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa kun la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa kun la //
translated: the bodhisattva is skilled in all the stages.

original: thabs ni mtshungs pa med pa ste //
analyzed: thabs ni mtshungs pa med pa ste //
translated: The means of the bodhisattvas is incomparable.

original: thabs mkhas de la brten nas ni //
analyzed: thabs mkhas de la brten nas ni //
translated: Relying on that skill in means,

original: de dag don kun sgrub par byed //
analyzed: de dag don kun sgrub par byed //
translated: they accomplish all their goals.

original: 'dis ni thabs la mkhas pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang las bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni thabs la mkhas pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang las bstan te /
translated: This shows the analysis and the function of skill in means.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Therein, the means of perfecting the buddha-qualities is the nonconceptual intuition.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'o //
translated: The means of developing living beings is the four social practices.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ni sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags so zhes bya ba nas bdag gi ye shes rdzogs par byang chub par gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar te /
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ni sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags so zhes bya ba nas bdag gi ye shes rdzogs par byang chub par gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar te /
translated: , up to the perfection of my knowledge may become fully enlightened.

original: so sor bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / gsol ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: so sor bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / gsol ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: This is the confession of sins, the rejoicing in merit, the entreaty to the saviors not to pass away, and the dedication of the roots of virtue.

original: bya ba 'grub pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams te /
analyzed: bya ba 'grub pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams te /
translated: The accomplishment of action is the doors of concentration and retention,

original: de dag gis sems can gyi don gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sems can gyi don gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by them the bodhisattva accomplishes the aims of beings.

original: lam rgyun mi gcod pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: lam rgyun mi gcod pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The uninterrupted path is nonabiding nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa thams cad la thabs rnam pa lnga po 'di dag la mkhas pa ni de las gzhan pa dag dang mtshungs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa thams cad la thabs rnam pa lnga po 'di dag la mkhas pa ni de las gzhan pa dag dang mtshungs pa med pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas skill in these five kinds of means on all the stages is incomparable with that of others.

original: 'di ni rab tu dbye ba yin no /
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu dbye ba yin no /
translated: This is the analysis.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don thams cad sgrub pa ni las so //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don thams cad sgrub pa ni las so //
translated: Its action is the accomplishment of all the aims of self and others.

original: gzungs @230a * //
analyzed: gzungs @230a * //
translated: Dhāraṇī

original: rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /
translated: 1. The retention of the result of evolution,

original: rnam smin thos la goms pa dang // ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs dag ni //
analyzed: rnam smin thos la goms pa dang // ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs dag ni //
translated: of hearing, of habituation, and of samadhi,

translated: The three samadhis are the spheres of

analyzed: gang zag dang chos dag la bdag tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: smon pa med pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin no //

analyzed: stong nyid la sogs ting 'dzin rnams //

original: don rnam gsum du yongs su bsgrags //
analyzed: don rnam gsum du yongs su bsgrags //

analyzed: smon pa med pa ni de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten spang ba'i phyir yin no //

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de nye bar zhi ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir yin no //
